0vdUr-T2Qgx5_98F8N1rEg.review_text: After being in the original Munich Oktoberfest twice, I got to say I really appreciate a good beergarden.  Good beer (but not a big selection), some interesting German snacks and joint tables for the ambiance.  Only missing ingredient is some German music, but obviously a no-go cause it's outside.

yXtStKz2c9LVLPd1_LgjsA.review_text: Like the concept of this place and wished there were more spots like this in the city.  I don't however like the long beer lines.   If you can beat the rush and are with a big group, this is a fun spot to chill on a sunny afternoon with some good bier.

PZsSSCa-XXZWBQhiPy8nPg.review_text: If the weather's nice and you want to just chill with some friends, you should definitely come here! But make sure you come early, it gets packed QUICK. I like the beer selection and the mugs they're served in. Brass Monkey was particularly delicious - taste like straight up OJ but the buzz totally creeped up on me!  It's a little pricey ($8 for a small and $16 for a large) but the environment's chill and it's exactly what you need if you ever want to remind yourself that you're in San Francisco.   Stay away from the pretzels.

swqPgaC_wLtmVbCYxIpOqw.review_text: Great place to chill with friends and grab a drink on a nice SF weekend afternoon. Good soft pretzels and decent selection of beers. A place like this has been much needed in Hayes Valley and it's finally here!

RCKdmKDZRd-RovZVtNSCLA.review_text: Had to fend off reserving a whole table for a friend's birthday party from at least four different groups by myself while the others waited in the long line to get our drinks. Quite packed. At least we got liter size glasses to make up for it once they all arrived! Beer and cider were ehhh-okay, not worth my near-verbal sword fights for the table, though.

i9KBEfzbXMSg0rrCYNyVlQ.review_text: Okay beer but count me in on a sunny SF day!  I had huge expectations, Biergarten, because you're German.  Your Organic Wheat beer was a disappointment but I liked the easygoing environment.   Please surprise me with your dark beer next time! I'll be back!

DeNozkS0rQSRj6kSqf6XMQ.review_text: What a great spot for good German beer on tap and tasty pub food...  Went here on a cold foggy night and ordered up their dopplebock and hefeweizen along with pork belly sliders (small but delicious with tender pork belly and slaw), and bratwurst and curried potatoes.  They have blankets on every picnic table to warm up those cold bodies as well...  Fun casual atmosphere...  I can just imagine this place hopping in the day when the sun is actually shining.  Will be back (probably on a sunnier day).

Sfptoj3XVpb1ggNoT3kJmg.review_text: My favorite bar in sf. Great beer and sausage on a sunny afternoon. Now that's hard to beat!

7NAJgRTLbOknvc5RJ-5yRg.review_text: Let me just put it this way: no beer is worth an hour wait in line.  The food was good, but mostly heavy german style dishes with a lot of sausage and the like.  Sure the beer was good, but definitely not worth having to fight for a table, standing in line for literally an hour, and paying a premium for all of it to boot.  I won't be back.

qVKPE3u1AKFsAg40I9HXZw.review_text: Nice place to hang out and have a nice cold beer. However, there's always a line and can get very crowded. Also, you will get burnt since they don't have any shades or you will freeze because they don't have one of those oversized outside heater. Not very accommodating. Perhaps once you've had a glass or two, you won't really care anymore. One thing, I love their pretzels!

4Dp4k3MMcxg9rPtJ8iU9Ag.review_text: Went there for lunch on a really nice warm day - it was awesome. Friendly attentive people, simple and quick food, good beer - what else do you need from a beergarden?  BTW their pretzels are to die for - make sure to order one (or two :)

0pb7fWD194iTqPMFAG5Oxg.review_text: Pretty impressed with Biergarten. The space is cool and reminds me of a slightly more antiseptic Zeitgeist. Their pretzels are very nice--warm and chewy but with a good taste. I'd imagine if I ate sausage they'd be pretty good too.  Taking credit cards is a big plus--though I wish they had a slightly larger selection of beers. There really don't have anything "big"--even the dark larger tastes more like a light ale than a porter.

Ci09Eo4ElA_NMDeMVzbJ8Q.review_text: Beer + outside + pretzels = why havent you been yet?? If you're still hungry, stop by Suppernkuche up the street!

nd1Z0OCN5H6BaEr77HMLuA.review_text: this place was just ok.  was really excited to try it out, but i wasn't too impressed.  they didn't have too many beers to choose from.  why not just go to zeitgeist down the way?  also, we ordered this lemonade/beer concoction...  we thought it would be lemony... but really it ended up just tasting super sweet.  gross.  after just a couple sips we knew we didn't want any more and would be just trying to choke it down.  so, we took the beers back and asked for something else.  one of the people behind the counter looked appalled.. the other just looked extremely uncomfortable.  ummm, ok?  we just didn't like our drink, is that so weird?  because of the discomfort, while she was pouring our next beer, we said we could pay for the ones we didn't drink and we got a nervous laugh in response.  as we sat and drank our second beers, we wondered if we would actually be charged for the two beers we only took a sip of.  when we got our check, yup, we got charged for them.  seriously?  they couldn't just leave off the two *draft* beers we didn't drink?  most places, would just give you a  freebie.  i was pretty surprised.  i mean, they couldn't even have maybe left *one* of the beers off?!  in the end, we paid 30$ plus tip for just two beers.  honestly, if they had even say, given us 5$ off or *any* kind of gesture, i would have felt better.  but no.

ca3PcljTCw0DORwj5AKHaA.review_text: The concept is really cool and you really want to like it, but the line is ridiculous. We waited over an entire hour in line just to get beer. There are "wait staff" walking around but seems like they only deliver food and clean up, they do not deliver beer which is a huge miss for this location. If the wait staff were allowed to deliver beer people would be more inclined to hang around. It seems like over half the line got tired of waiting and just left (big loss of business for this location). The bar staff was extremely nice. We tried to host a birthday party here on a pretty weather day, but it was really hard to get people to stay because of the lines. We also tried to contact the management 3 times to this location and no one ever returned our calls (big disappointment) even if just to tell us they don't take reservations. As we live in the neighborhood, we really want this spot to be successful and think it should cater more to locals in the neighborhood. Good luck with this location as we're probably not coming back until the service and lines get better. We really want you to be successful in a way that it keeps us wanting to come back and bring other people into our super cool neighborhood.

tjScd5xMVw-t2-IbKLTDIA.review_text: The food was tasty, the beer was good. The food took forever and *DISCLAIMER* there was no warning for how tiny the food is. I got a pretzel sandwich and my friend got a veggie burger... HA! What a joke. They looked like things that should be served at a tapas place... Not filling at all and despite its tastiness, not worth the money/the wait.

TBhOThtDs6uBIKvPJlSkJg.review_text: Beer was plentiful and the pretzels were awesome!  Only down side was a lack of wait staff and an abundance of bearded hipsters.  Cool out door spot in the city to go and chill with friends.

fHnAHkd0rNscAXlWpy7M9Q.review_text: One of my favorite bars in SF!  On a sunny day, this place can't be beat. It also reminds me of biergartens when I lived in Berlin. You order your food at the window and take it back to your communal picnic table. I always order litres or else I'd be made fun of. $16 for a litre of most beers and $8 for .5. They also bring in food from Suppenküche from down the street. That's a huge plus.  The only drawback is the huge line. Since the place opens at 3:00pm, the line usually wraps around the corner by 2:50pm. The longest part of getting your drink will be waiting in line. If you come closer to sunset (also when it's colder), you'll get your drinks faster. Good luck coming on a warm and sunny day ~ even though these are the best days to come.  Last but not least, the bathrooms are actually very nice for a bar. Surprising how they can repurpose old shipping containers to be so cool.

IcDn5f-a5mt7v3WnFBvOdg.review_text: It's a shame that dogs are not allowed in an outdoor beer garden. Totally ridiculous.

4LKzJQi_PLchNXNrLbmxyw.review_text: One of the few true outdoor places to drink in the city to enjoy some nice bavarian brews. For the most part its a pretty legit beer garden with great beer decent small bites and a nice place to hipster watch.   Their line system is of course, puts the TSA to shame. They really ought to fix that.

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: great place to spend a sunny day, but be prepared to wait in a long ass long for drinks!  they have radlers here and huge steins of beer, so it's pretty amazing.  if you go on a thurs night, off the grid is there too!

DYqrl-2nzFvE0KpdgmYyCg.review_text: Really?? They serve beer in a parking lot void of any personality.  Your dog is not allowed on their outdoor parking lot and they recommend that you tie your dog up on the city sidewalk so you can see them through the chain link fence.  So lame.

5O3bu2s6T-bc84w6zIQT1Q.review_text: The pork belly sliders are the best I have eaten anywhere in the world.  The selection of wine and the rest of the food is meh....

fES_Ws1CDBUw7vcTJzr8CA.review_text: I enjoyed my visit here yesterday for a very sunny Friday afternoon.  My friends and I weren't the only ones who finished their day early and decided to head here, however- seating was like a wrestling match and the line for beers is ridiculous, bordering on 30+ minutes.  Contrasted with absolutely NO line for their food, there is clearly an organizational/logistical/operational problem which this place needs to tackle in order to maximize their clearly popular concept.  The beer was great, the pretzels we chowed on were awesome- but the line and crowd will scare me off.  30 or more minutes in line for a $12 liter of beer? Sorry guys, fix this or I'll find somewhere else to blow my cash...

ucvTVzBMSGkLjzHqPdCM9A.review_text: Pickled deviled eggs.  I don't even like anything pickled or pickles but these were glorious. They had some kind of butter spread on top - pretty sure that's what made them as glorious as they were. Do not miss out on these.  Sidenote: first time ever having deviled eggs. I'm not ashamed to admit that, okay?!

3-Fdl-0rn3eE-ofvfoQqeA.review_text: Went there with girlfriends. The beer was fine, the food was also fine but the ambience was not too enjoyable in the foggy chilly area like SF.

jiJzsDbf5vLRYiLU_5rLnQ.review_text: Great spot for an afternoon beer! Several good German selections on tap, some decent-looking food options (only had the pretzel, but there were other offerings), and a surprisingly nice ambiance for being made up of converted shipping containers and basic benches on asphalt. Friday crowd filled up pretty quickly after the 3pm opening, and the beer line never really got short- recommend an early arrival and ordering the 1L beers to minimize trips.  Hopefully other SF entrepreneurs will take note and create more spots like this- very convivial and fun.

rTKQb1xQwykzMzCdc973dQ.review_text: I like the conecpt of drinking outside (admirer of Zeitgeist).  They do sell half and full liter beers at reasonalbe prices.  It's still new so expect to wait on long lines but the turnover is pretty fast so by the time you get a beer/food, there will be a place to sit.  I must say, after ordering food with our beer, the cost skyrocketed.  The food is very expensive for what you get.  For the cost of aONE bratwurst and some sauerkraut, you can buy 2 packages of Aidelle's sausages (I'm just sayin').  Despite my 2 star rating, I will go back for the beer and ambience - but I will eat first.

UySLQuZU6SOuuMO4J74x7w.review_text: Outdoor drinking!  Gets very packed.  But it is a great social atmosphere with communal picnic bench seating.  Get:  The 1L Beer.  The line gets long and isn't that quick, so you want to minimize your visits.  Frankfurt Special - Skinny sausage on  a pretzel bun with a pile of sauerkraut, jalapeño slices, and mustard.

5O8fn99pTl2r72AfySA_9g.review_text: This place is sooo fun! If you have not been yet, just go! It's literally a fenced in concrete area with a bunch of picnic tables and old shipping containers used as the vendor stands. Do not be alarmed, there may be a very long line to enter, but it moves a lot faster than you would expect. The beer is all so fresh and delectable. It is hard not to drink it so fast because it is so refreshing. There is a large assortment and varying sizes to choose from. I think my hubby chose liters. Aside from the beer, the pretzels are also delicious. Yum! I've heard the rest of the food is great as well. In addition to the eating and drinking, this is also the perfect spot to meet all sorts of people. Since long picnic tables are your only seating option, chances are you'll be sharing with strangers. We were there about five hours and it never got old.

WPBrjBbk76ZtZQ8QpG09cQ.review_text: Nice beergarden  This place seems to always have a long line, and for good reason--the vibe is really chill and the beer is good! Need you ask more?  Located literally in a park on the road, this place is hard to visit. The opening hours are very restrictive (2pm to 8pm for an alcohol place? that's crazy, like having a brunch place open at night!). We were there before the 2pm opening time and there was already a line waiting outside the gate. Wooot  Once the place opened, the inside was packed. All the benches were filled with people, and there was still a line outside. Even though there's a lot of folks in the house, the place is chill--folks everywhere are chatting, sipping beers, laughing, having a good time.  In terms of beer quality, the drinks are solid. You can get a large cup of 1L beer--nice. I got the brass monkey, which was a OJ mixed beer--pretty orangy :) Definitely recommend going for the 1L cup if you have a chance.  Will definitely visit again if I can somehow be there during opening hours!

jC5AmzkXDYxdxbosStlo7g.review_text: Awesome!!! Seriously felt like I was in Germany. I had the wheat beer and we shared some food: a regular pretzel, sunflower pretzel, and the pork belly sliders. All the food was yummy and they have specials every day too. Really diligent staff that was always walking around picking up empty glasses, food trays, and offering blankets. What a cool concept. This is a good place to take visitors.

FIDPP65G4FxtZfqt5HwWWg.review_text: Big sister Suppenkuche serves traditional German food and a good selection of alcohol. Like older siblings, Suppenkuche has that confidence that no one tries to mess with. And it shows because there's always a line! (Minimum wait on a Saturday night is 1 hour.) They've perfected keeping people happy, and you can tell with the solid four star rating with 2,500 reviews!  Little sister Biergarten is a little similar, yet has its own flair. (Younger siblings were always a little more rebellious, right?) It's outdoors and fenced around. Pro-tip: you order the food and beer, and your friend grabs a table. When the weather is nice, you bet all the tables are taken!   - Beers come in half liters or liters. Go big or go home! - Food was good and reasonably priced. The pork belly sliders were yummy! - No "real" service - they bring out your food and clear the table. - There's a park right in front, and Smitten is just around the corner. - Wed-Sat 2-8pm. Sun 1-7pm.  This place is just like a little sister - carefree, easy going, and fun! Cheers!

9nHUuynPPe249rHJSPhv2A.review_text: It's closed on Tuesdays, which is one of my days off, so it sucks that I can't come here on that day.   I've only had beer here, it's a place where we either stop by before or after dinner.   It's outside, right across from a play area so if you have kids, you can definitely dump them there and pop into Biergarten for a drink (I actually suggested this to a friend and he said it was a good idea, but he never did it.)  When it gets cold you can use one of the blankets that they offer but it's itchy and who knows who's been using it, so I really suggest you bring your own to use if you are anticipating the weather to be cold.

qmen9LSJNO5uuT72NV_tGQ.review_text: 1 liter Radler (shandy), huge bratwurst, kraut, mustard .. so awesome. There's not much protection from the heat or cold (it's SF the weather changes quickly) but this place is great. It's first come first serve, order at the counter and then sit at communal picnic tables. Be ready to wait it's usually pretty busy here and for good reason.

1rQMqmHC_YAzvtap-GfzUg.review_text: Came on a Sunday afternoon, had no problem getting a table. We actually switched because the guys we were sharing the first one with were geeking out over some HTML writing and the "hella" was slowly driving me to implosion. We quickly found someplace else to sit and then shortly after that, the older woman working sat an obviously lost couple at the end of the table. I thought it was kinda cool that they help you sit if you're a shy newbie.  The beers are nothing to write home about. They don't have many... about 13-15 available, but I enjoyed my light beer, my husband enjoyed his dark beer and my friends chugged their gigantic ones. We're from LA, where people don't do communal, so it was nice just to sit and BE with other people--- I noticed a distinct diversity in ages, races, orientations, families, etc. Also, people actually spoke to each other... rather than getting lost in their cell phones. Wonderful to see.  Fun way to spend a couple of hours and great for those new to SF. If I lived here, I'd definitely come back and bring out-of-towners.

zGSnyzu6ntVm2h5yqiTOUw.review_text: O-ver-ra-ted! *clap-clap-clapclapclap*  Biergarten does not suck.  But there are better restaurants and bars for ambience, beer selection/quality, and food quality that don't have the:   *long waits (plural: long wait to get in, long waits for beers/food)   *high prices that make Biergarten very avoidable.  Staff are cool, as were the most of the other patrons.

pwlWt2yHIoo0fv7LLoTw9w.review_text: Pros: delicious beer, good food, cool mugs, sun!, chill atmosphere. Cons: long line for food/beer and expensive  We went there on a Sunday afternoon. They open at 1:00 so we got there at 1:15 ish to get a picnic table. You definitely need to get there by 1:30 if you want a table. The line for beer/food at that time was about a 10 minute wait. There is only one line and one bar. The line later in the day got to be about 25 minutes. The first time we got small beers ($8) because we were afraid the big ones would get warm. Second time around we got the large beers ($16) and dealt with the warming of the beer under the lovely sun.  Will definitely we back on the next warm, sunny day.

sByGGOqRMHxxexwkzPCJcA.review_text: This place just opened so I'm cutting them some slack because:  1.) I love the concept and applaud them for getting this off  the ground  2.) I think they will work out the kinks  3.) I hope this will create opportunities for more restaurants/bars like this one  We arrived right at 3pm when the Biergarten opened and waited in line for about 30 minutes to get in, then waited another 20-30 minutes for a beer and a pretzel.  Kind of a long wait, but the place is new and I'm hoping they will work out a better way to handle the flow of people in/out/serving beers.  The staff was beyond friendly and a bit apologetic about getting things going with the new space.  Totally understandable.  The beers were big and delicious and the pretzels really hit the spot.  I did not have a sausage, but will definitely go back for one.    It's not uber cheap (two giant beers came to approx. $21) but I guess that's just what giant beers go for in Hayes Valley.    The atmosphere is still a little bleak - it's basically a chain link fence around a parking lot with picnic tables and a few trees for shade.  However, it looks like vines are being grown on the fence and the trees will fill out.  Lots of potential!

ibSIRYjrJG2oaLHDL2fhog.review_text: Biergarten is super yummy! The beer is great and served in large quantities and the food is delicious.   I'm a huge fan of the meat and cheese pretzel knots. Oh and the bratwurst is so good --- the mustard and sauerkraut served with it is fantastic. Also, homemade pickles and pickled carrots and the horseradish...drooling just thinking about it.   Spend some time outside and enjoy what Beirgarten has to offer. I challenge you to not have a good time :P   Next stop is the sister restaurant Suppenküche.

SRz0Q-tsPd1SU8bvFi_ToA.review_text: Heaven on Earth.  btw- you want a "whiniest bitches in SF list"?  Read the reviews that give this place 1 star.  They all need to be checked.    Long lines....whhhhhaaaaah!   No dogs allowed........whhhhaaaaaah!    Too busy......whhhhhhhaaaah!    People in this city have no backbone.

xXOslATLpvnZXx03pQFovg.review_text: One and done. The beer is too expensive, the waiters are not nice, and the kimchi hot dog was not very tasty. The only draw is the atmosphere, but it is still not enough to get me to come back. The beer was good, but I recommend the sangria at Fly.  P.s. They don't serve Keystone

YReDScLBqPQSStal5Pcs8g.review_text: What an excellent place! The bier is great! The food looked good (I'd had lunch before I found this place). I loved the vibe! The place was packed & I could see why. Biergarten's are great for meeting other people due to the communal seating which is cool if you are a visitor. Clean & neat & a very friendly staff. Prost!

Ic6-gs1_FjrWGx6JIr95Mw.review_text: Celebrating a sunny and warm day at the Biergarten would be a normal thing to do.  My only experience at the Biergarten was when it was chilly and an hour before closing on a week night.  However, I really loved it!  They were completely out of food, which is a huge pet peeve of mine when going out, but we had no problem getting beer.  You can choose between a liter and a half liter.  Plus, If you come at night, there is a much shorter line, and there are wool blankets to keep you warm.  The selection isn't massive, but what they are serving is delicious.  I had the Schneider Weisse, and it was my favorite beer ever.  It had hints of banana and some spices, and I would totally recommend it.  It's a darker color, but it does not taste like it at all.  I tried sips of two other things as well that were good, but I have no idea what they were.    What really warmed my heat over was that they have Almdudler.  I spent an entire summer in Austria and drank SO MUCH Almdudler.  While it's a bit more expensive than the home country, it was nice to see some non-alcoholic beverages with the German theme as well.

mD3YEkX-fjVX738o11O0kg.review_text: Whether you're a local or just visiting SF, Biergarten is not to be missed! Ideal place for a "sunday funday" boozy lunch or just want feel like it's Octoberfest year round.  FOOD: Who doesn't love pretzels and beer?! If you are a weirdo who doesn't like beer, wine is also available for 6 bucks a cup (literally served in a cup). I recommend a liter of Munich Gold ($14) and a cheese knot (like a grilled cheese with shallots on an amazing fresh pretzel roll, $6) Lactose intolerant? Get the frankfurter on an equally amazing fresh pretzel bun with a sour kraut topper and spicy brown mustard-heaven! Anything you order will be delicious. Even if you are allergic to calories and order a kale salad-still awesome!!   SETTING: Outdoor wooden benches situated in what looks like a parking lot with a chain link fence around it. Everything is served out of grey boxy bungalows and gives it a very industrial vibe. When the sun goes down and the temp drops, they have blankets available for those unprepared for SF weather. So thoughtful!   TIPS: Bring money for the meter (they charge on Sundays now) and a deck of cards for fun drinking games if the conversation is lacking. Get there early! By 2pm, the line tends to extend past the gates and seating will be hard to come by as people like to camp out for the afternoon.

x2-TP8fd4G0OqkgDyKt3IA.review_text: An outdoor biergarten is like something straight out of a movie. Legally drinking in the outdoors in the middle of the city is such a great idea!! Why couldn't I think of this...  Anyway, I've only been here twice, and both times were great. I've tried the Frankziskaner $6 and Weiheinstephaner $6. Pretty standard pricing. I've also tried a few dishes - Pickled plate - I had no idea ginger can be pickled, same with carrots, garlic, and a few other things. Frankfurter - yummy sausage served with sauerkraut and a house dijon mustard. Pork Risette dish - which is served on pieces of toast and topped with mustard seeds and chopped chives. Everything was delicious and great for an afternoon snack/early dinner.   If you ever have the chance to stop by Biergarten be sure to dressed in layers, the restaurant does have blankets out for the customers, but you never know with the bipolar SF weather. Cheers!

TLdtuZm6Ms0V22I6htXBaQ.review_text: When SF weather is favorable, this is an awesome place to hang out with friends + beers. It's lively, clean, and open. They have a limited food menu, but everything we tried was surprisingly delicious-- especially the cheese knot, egg salad, and pork sliders.  It may seem crowded, but people are always coming and going so getting a table just requires a little patience. There are also very clean restrooms for use. Heat lamps would be nice because it gets cold so quickly.

n2-zPkdWd7Y_zwOjwkCtnQ.review_text: Good beers, good atmosphere, and great neighborhood to hangout.

IfanXVYDpduyvMEi7-A-bw.review_text: Came here on a beautiful SF winter day.  Got a liter of beer with my bro (actual brother), and sat down next to some people.   Ordered a pretzel with horseradish and mustard.  Eating horse radish feels like an inverted punch to the nose, coming from inside your head, and it really hit me good.  I love horseradish, and the stuff here was like the Falcon punch (super smash bros reference) of horseradish.  The mustard has the kick of a horse too.  They have blankets here for the cold.  Don't fear the long line, it's actually a good thing.  After you finish your first liter, your party can get up, go get some more liters, and find a new crowd to sit around.  It means you get to meet more people and get some different views on the beer garden.  This place is all about socializing.  While we were there, a wedding party decided to roll in and take pictures.  I'm not sure why you'd want to take pictures on your wedding day surrounded by random drunk people, but maybe you're into that kind of thing.  Everyone was clapping for them, but I had no idea who they were.  For all we know it could have been an elaborate street performance.  All in all, Biergarten is a good time.  It supplies you with a rich crowd and a social environment, and big beer to get you nice and saucy (OR BLOATED, but that's just me, right?).

f64QFd02f_s9zhNMleePSQ.review_text: Love the Biergarten! Great Beer and snacks. I love coming here for a drink, such a cool atmosphere and the cargo bins just work!

VpRouMPIQfycx3bTnIbuaw.review_text: Got there on a Saturday at 6:30 PM. The line to buy your drink was long. Took about 20-30 minutes. Good German beer at a decent price. I had friends there already so I didn't have to find a seat, but from what I noticed, it's not that hard to get a seat around the time that I went even though the line to buy beer took a while.  One thing though: it was hella cold! They give out some thick fleece/woolish blankets once the sun starts to set. However, they may feel kind of grimey as you do not know who else used the them and how often they were washed.  Some heat lamps would've definitely made the experience 1 star better

ma3r4D8KZ0Ksjpv-sU0QJw.review_text: This beer garden is awesome! It's basically a bunch of wooden picnic tables right in the middle of Hayes Valley, enclosed by a fence, so you can people-watch, or people can watch you drink your ginormous 1L beers.   They have a great selection of German beers, and their pretzel (comes with mustard and horse radish) is so soft and delicious! This is a cool place to hang out with friends and grab a beer, or more like 3 (=1 liter). You could get less than 1 liter, but where's the fun in that? Smitten is also right next to this place so you can grab some ice cream after!   But GET HERE EARLY, like before-it-opens-early because I guarantee you will wait forever in line. We waited 30 minutes before it opened and there were people in front of us who took all the shaded benches already, which was the reason for my sunburn this weekend.

X4KWGuzlDtkE4tjKwXyszA.review_text: Just get your  stein of good beer and enjoy! Awesome place to have couple good beers with good friends. The place always looked packed - but somehow we always managed to find a spot for a group of 4-6 ppl. You will be sharing long tables, that's expected. All seating is outside - and they provide blankets if beer does not keep you warm enough.   One wish - expand collection of pilsners and get more food choices.

Bo1QKbB_zkvNhT_4ngsVyA.review_text: Hit the Biergarten yesterday after work around six.  No line to get in but the beer line was about five minutes.  The Swaztenbier was awesome in a great big stein and the brat was delicious.  You don't get a bun, but the hot horseradish and spicy mustard along with the sauerkraut make a meal.  The grey shipping container facilities gives the place an industrial "Sprokets" ambiance, but the bathrooms are roomy and clean.  Nice work!

jXEo83-Cm6SlgiCgFbF7KQ.review_text: Beer -- good but they ran out of one kind.  They only have 3 kinds!  Also, it was expensive.  The smaller size of beer (which is still plenty big) is $8.  The large size is $15.    I shared a large beer with my boyfriend and a brat basket, which is two bratwursts and one "pretzel" (pretty small if you ask me) for $18.  Two hotdogs and a ball of bread for nearly $20?  Luckily we weren't too hungry.  I wouldn't order this dish again.  The sauerkraut was good . . .   Best thing about this place is the outdoor tables.  It has cute white lights that brighten it up at night and give it a fun atmosphere.  It was pretty busy for a Wednesday when I went.  Crowd was late 20s.  I would go back here only for the beer, not for the food.  But it is a unique option when Suppenkuche is too busy to seat you.  And, they bring the food to the table (they give you a number when you order) which is a nice touch.

EhIolH5byA5_IO7VVZyAPQ.review_text: Decent selection of beers and friendly staff to tell you about each. It can get really crowded, but is definitely worth waiting for on a sunny day.

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: Its awesome! But how could authentic German beer be bad, really? Ok, well, the one caveat-- there were babies here. Babies at a bar? Not the best idea.  BUT THEIR SAUSAGE! OMG. BEST BRATWURST I'VE HAD IN THE CITY! And I go for sausage quite a bit.   Fun fact- don't come here on a tuesday. Despite the fact Yelp says they're open, they aren't, and you and your roommate will be pissed you're standing around outside a chain link fence and dirt area sans beer. True story.

IhVTv8VJyCDPVyFvXEloKQ.review_text: I've been there three times now and this place is HAPPENING!!!! I love the outdoor seating! You get a blankie too if it gets too cold and the long tables will help you make new friends easily.  Beer, beer, and more beer is all I can say! It's always crowded and lively! Such a fun spot to go to with a group of friends! It will def make you feel like you're in Germany!

eUveCtSdyOT4zbLIQZ_yIQ.review_text: Day drinking outdoors? Christmas lights and blankets after dark? I'm down.   German bier on tap and friendly staff to explain every eccentricity and flavor profile. Bathrooms in an adjacent shipping container are always a plus.

WKPTh4UmEqXR8TRAp1g2CA.review_text: Beer, brats and blankets to keep you warm. Great spot. Food was good and who doesn't like a liter of cola...I mean beer. Only minus- can't bring the dogs in.

d89lRBtRUBqJSCttUXvQTg.review_text: I am in love with the fact that a place like this exists.  It was so nice to walk up, order a fresh cold German beer and hang out with like minded folks.  Staff are super-friendly as well.  Be warned: shade is a limited commodity here.

hvjhcPOG8zuqqLOohDKBmA.review_text: We were exploring Hayes Valley and stumbled onto this fenced off section known as the Biergarten. There were plenty of benches all in which many different parties were sharing. You place your order at a counter that is made out of a large storage shed. I thought that this gave the establishment a unique characteristic. The menu is listed alongside the shed with a list of at least 10 biers as well as small tapa dishes like pretzels, pickles, and sausages in a mini plastic basket.    They offer you number placards for your order and deliver food to your table. Its a gorgeous place to relax on a sunny day. Of course, when ever I can, I order the .5 Liter of Radler (lemon flavored beer).    The enclosed area is very neat and tidy. Definitely another neighborhood gem.

9DhCT_2yEpIqAHVBXcecOw.review_text: This is exactly what you hope for and expect at a limited hours outdoor beer-drinking venue. It's roots are clearly German, offering schnitzel and steins of German beers with soft pretzels and artisan mustard, however it's spirit is clearly influenced by the happy-go-lucky drinking mentality of San Francisco that just so happens to have the limited days and hours of whenever it feels like and early.  Great spot, wish it was more available to people in the industry or people who don't go to bed at 8pm.

sCiWf7Kai0t-x25CAz2DEQ.review_text: Afternoon snack/meal brought the three of us here. We ordered the trio of salad, meat sandwich, beef tongue sliders, two pop and a beer.   The salad consisted of kraut, roasted beets, and potato salads. I'm usually not a fan of potato salad, but this one was delicious! The beet salad was awesome as well and you can't do wrong with kraut. The sandwich was salami and kraut in between a halved soft pretzel. This was great as well. The pretzel was amazingly soft. We wanted to order just a pretzel, but we were full. I didn't try the sliders, but I heard they were scrumptious too!  Overall a great outdoor eatery in Hayes Valley. I loved the environment and atmosphere

G8XOXaa0CRsMyv-n_zReUw.review_text: Mmmm... Bier and pretzels! It doesn't get  any better than this! I had the fort point red which was on point! The gf got the organic Weiss which was extra good!!! This is a beautiful little spot, with lots of cool ppl to watch... Everyone is so up beat and happy! Feel like I'm in the pharell because I'm happy video!

RGMVCOdS4KwUGJVRHqNLXg.review_text: Can't go wrong here... Great beer of course. Just the right temperature. They have a liter of beer and it's humongous!  The outdoor patio is perfect to meet new people especially after a few beers. I've tried different variations of wurst and they're all delicious. Next time I'll be tried the sliders or the burger. Great place to hang out in Hayes especially in good Indian Summer days in SF!

PvX64Pdmx-9WFBSuWrRuxg.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
PvX64Pdmx-9WFBSuWrRuxg.review_text: A blacktop surrounded by a chain-link fence? Is that your idea of a biergarten? Spend one day at a biergarten in Germany, and this place looks like a cheap attempt to attract a hipster crowd. But I wouldn't be writing this review if it weren't for the fact that you could not bring outside food in. You have two food trucks and some picnic tables, let a man eat his Ike's sandwich in peace!

xaSLaLcDdmnlSvLPI6-PNA.review_text: A German beer garden is something of a novelty here in SF, which explains why it was so crowded on an overcast Saturday afternoon in March.   If you can get past the crowds and grab a table then this is a pretty cool place to drink the day away. The beer is good (and comes in steins) and everybody seemed good natured and relaxed. Apparently the food is really good too.

h0kDxnRpBXyJ1v17uSDnzw.review_text: Went to our neighborhood pop-up pub with some friends and all the children.  Waited in line for about 10 which was fine because the weather was gorgeous and it was fairly easy to find a table albeit shared with another couple but why not?  Always fun doing things communal.  My 7 month old, (yes, I brought the baby to a pub) was totally enjoying all the surrounding attention and the sound his wooden spoon made on the picnic table.   Had a dark ale and the Wednesday burger special (divine) while my hubbs had some sort of mushroom cheese bread and the beets.  Why are pickled things so tasty?  Our friends woofed down the pretzels and sausage and the kiddos had pork sliders. All in all, perfect early dinner place and easy going vibe.  This is another reason why I love living in Hayes.

t5ZwpcQNvFZC1TwTxjiNUQ.review_text: This is such a great idea!  Outdoor socializing with beer and snacks.  On cold days/nights, they offer blankets to keep you nice and warm.  I've been here a couple times.  The first time I came here, they had a german band in costume which was pretty cool.  They offer a nice selection of beer on tap and some in bottle and a good selection of snacks.  You can choose either a 1/2 Liter or 1 Liter of beer.  As for snacks, I especially love the pretzel.  It's warm and soft and served with mustard.  Perfect combo with a nice glass of Schneider Weisse.  The second time I came here, the pretzel/bread maker happened to be on vacation so we were pretty bummed.  Hopefully the next time I visit, there will be pretzels with my beer!

b0lXNnfnZpKPv7xNwpG3Ig.review_text: Cool Concept (5stars) + Long long long long line for beer and food (2stars) + Only 3 beer choices (3stars) + Girl dispensing beer didn't go a good job, half of stein was head (2stars) + Delicious Sauerkraut (5stars) + Pricey food (3stars) + hard to find coed Porta-potty (1star) = somehow this averages to 3 stars!  BTW, is anyone willing to go here on a rainy day???

PKPt-PE4BMQ0ZHuGnXulAQ.review_text: Didn't know about this place till my friend told me about it..always passed it while getting off the freeway at Octavia.   It was a pretty nice day in San Francisco. Came to Biergarten right when it opened. There was a line already formed. One of the workers was checking ID's at the gate and giving everyone wristbands.  Ordered some beer I couldn't pronounce. 1 Liter for about $10. They had picnic tables all around. Pretty nice hangout spot to drink beer and chat

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: There is just something exceedingly nice about being able to drink outside. Especially when it's out of really enormous mugs ::steins!:: filled with delicious refreshing German beer. There are some pils, some weiss beers, and a dark one to get you going.   They also serve some food. We had the seeded pretzels which come studded with sunflower seeds with some mustard for dipping. The pretzels were tender and pretty great. We also had some brats with sauerkraut and I must say I was impressed by their quality. I've eaten a lot of brats in my day and these were pretty fantastic.  The line can be a pain but if you get there early it's not bad. Now go an enjoy the remaining days of SF indian summer we have.

zXynZ1Gvr9Bkqz5mJDaLEQ.review_text: We walked by here on the way to Smitten's across the street and knew that we had to check this place out. It's an old parking lot decked out with shipping containers that have been converted into food/beverage stands.  I had the Hefeweizen. My friend ordered some deviled eggs, along with a small bottle of some novelty German drink called Underberg. I have to say that Underberg is probably one of the nastiest drinks I've ever tried, it tasted like an alcoholic version of some potent Chinese herbal medicine. The eggs were dyed a bright, artificial pink, not too sure what the point of this was aside from wow factor. They were darn tasty though. Beer was good as well.  It's always nice to be able to enjoy beer outside, although it was pretty chilly that day. We did notice that the employees were handing out blankets to whoever wanted to bundle up some more. Very thoughtful.

QeBWmKeUBzVd_2m6Zeq10w.review_text: What's good: drinking in the sunshine, pink deviled eggs, getting slightly buzzed and ordering in an obnoxoious fake German accent and annoying the shit out of the nice hipster wait staff. Hipster mustache bingo.   Why I won't go back soon:  45 minutes in line for a beer. Das ist nicht gil. Das ist shit man.

Kr9sA9gKISX5i8WN4_nXcQ.review_text: if the weather is nice, then this is a great place to come and hang out...the beer selection could grow, they only had 3 types of beers when we went, but they were pretty good. We had the tacos...which seem an odd choice for a beer garden, but they were actually delicious.  The place seems to always be crowded, so finding a seat may be a bit of a challenge sometimes, but definitely a place worth checking out.

WXVZtXqjgHtueNIBniwjqg.review_text: the staff here sucks. at least on the night i came with my cousin and the place was empty. (1/18 or 1/19)  i'm sure its a little more reasonable to be a bit short and snide when the place is packed and its super busy but on a quiet night, be nice!! the person pouring my beer was fine, but the ladies patrolling around the place like it was a catholic school playground was obnoxious. i was scared my hand was gonna get slapped with a ruler if i didn't drink my beer fast enough. it was 7:30 and I ordered a beer and pretzel, my 20 year old cousin had a non alcoholic lemonaid. i had no idea they closed at 8 pm, just arrived from nyc. maybe you should tell me as i order my beer, just so you know we are closing soon but please enjoy your beer. i pulled out a napkin and an extra one fell on the table. lady comes over and fixes the display. really? i am half way through my pretzel and lady comes by and the napkin stand with utensils is taken away. my pretzel is finished- which tastes excellent, but i am still eating those yummy seeds that fell off and she takes away my basket. don't touch my plate!! ugh!! i would come again if it was amazing sunny day and it was so crowded i wouldnt notice the attitude that exudes from the ladies on staff. lighten up and let people enjoy its a freakin beer garden!

le8Ez2XRHspLqxKAS59jeQ.review_text: The place is basically five shipping containers and a fenced in lot.  The beer was good but VERY pricey.  The food was good but VERY pricey.  ALL seating is outside.  ALL picnic tables to be shared with whoever wants/needs a table.  No roofs over any tables.  Reminds me of the story of "The Emperor Has No Clothes".  If the food and drink was cheaper, I'd give them a better review.  I spent $70 on two 1 liter beers, one cider and one order of sausage and potatoes and tip.  To me, that's pricey.  The place looks and feels like a prison yard with the chain link fence.  Don't get caught up in the hype.  There are places that MUST be just as good with better ambiance, food and beer for cheaper.  Skip it!

qqKddLtLxbPnTf6c7yqS3g.review_text: New favorite place to go with friends on those rare sunny sf days.

MBQlD-rwvSb8Dtfw5I2_xA.review_text: Spent a lot of time standing in line for a beer whilst discussing San Franciscans predilection for standing in lines. Some places in this fair city are worth the wait -- Tartine and Bi-Rite Creamery come to mind -- but Biergarten is not one of them. While those other establishments create a product that is simply superior to other offerings in the city, Biergarten serves a limited selection of mediocre beer (it is German, after all) and good (not great) food. Special shout out to the delightfully pickled deviled eggs, and the pretzels are legit, but it's tough to justify some of the prices for the other menu items.  I do really like the aesthetic of this place. Some people might get turned off because they feel like they're drinking beer in what amounts to a glorified parking lot, but I think it has an inviting, urban park charm. It benefits from a thoughtful, modern industrial architecture where the kitchen, bar, and bathrooms are all built in giant gray shipping containers (very cool), the tables are simple and sturdy, and the openness of the space affords ample people watching.   But man, that line! Would you go to a bar if I told you that you had to wait thirty minutes every time you wanted another beer? I doubt it. The food is better than the beers at this place, and the food line is generally short and easy to navigate, but you want your beer to keep flowing if you're settling in for an afternoon at a place like this, and it just doesn't. Some reviewers think it's a glaring operational problem, but I'm quite sure the management likes it the way it is. Why would they feel the need to change their service style if there is a never ending 30+ minute line full of patrons willing to wait it out? It undoubtedly creates turnover at the tables and helps to keep customers drunkenness levels in check.   I love outdoor day drinking as much as the next guy, and there is obviously serious demand at this place. I just think I'll take my talents to someplace like Zeitgest or Lucky 13 instead and head back to order my second (much tastier) beer from the bar as quickly as it would take you to get one less flavorful offering from Biergarten. That line is for suckers.

91YfQoC9Np0Dj6UaSpX2Rw.review_text: 2 stars for the location and the fun casual ambiance.  For a beer garden, they only had 4-5 options on tap, which sucked. The snack options are limited but taste good, based on the couple of things we ordered.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Tell me why. One reason why Germany's Paul Van Dyk is awesome: youtube.com/watch?v=2mCQ… Few reasons why German Biergarten is awesome: Excellent homemade veggie sliders, delicious beet salad and a full of flavor (and sauerkraut) bratwurst on a pretzel roll. Plus homemade pickles and a Weihenstephaner lager so light and easy to drink that there was a bit of regret on this warm(ish) July night for not getting the large size. Much like a packed PVD show get ready to be close with your neighbors as seating is all at communal tables. Atmosphere is lively but not too loud. At roughly $25 a person this will not be a cheap excursion. But like a really good DJ experience a really good dining experience shouldn't be either. Enjoy finding your own reasons for giving four stars.

1J-CWvcyB8FDmyZ_GEmvpw.review_text: We came on a Sunday afternoon at around 1pm when they opened. Soon after, all the tables filled up and the lineup for beer and food reached 45 minutes.   Food: curry wurst / bratwurst were delicious. Had the wheat beer too which was pretty good. Overall, pretty decent.   Setting: picnic bench-type seating with no overhead shading. Bring sunblock or cover up. Lots of us got burned.  There are two separate washrooms for men and women though I was told there's a urinal in the women's washroom.   Summary: prepare to wait. Bring sunblock. Go early for a table.

wXaAnWNnFDjx-jfHiSEEig.review_text: Good, cold German beer, outdoors in the sunshine?  What could be better?  My only gripe - the lengthy wait to actually get a beer...45 minutes!  But at the end it was definitely worth it...just make sure you get enough to tide you over, unless you want to get back in line and wait to get the second round.

vF9C7jqC2uPkBfTiecUeuA.review_text: Since this city seems to have a huge lack of restaurants/bars with nice outdoor patios, this place is a little gem in my opinion. With giant tables (that are to be shared with strangers and friends alike) overlooking the small park in Hayes Valley, the Biergarten makes a perfect destination for a sunny afternoon.  After dark, they turn on the hanging lights above. This would give the place a romantic atmosphere, if it weren't for people shouting "chug, chug, chug!!!" around you.   Yes, the line to the bar can get a little long, but use that time to make a new friends with some of the folks waiting there with you. Once you order, don't forget to grab a pretzel or bratwurst basket to go with your with a tasty beverage.

bMZYSJTOEB5zOknVA2btGA.review_text: I wanted to like this place but in the end was disappointed. Over priced. Long lines. Hot beer. Hard to find a place to sit. Point blank - go somewhere else!

u5GdkFvaYXVLCpcPl3NIAg.review_text: The idea is great but execution is poor. The beer is the best part, quality beer and you can get a liter glass, great!  But with only 4 taps operated by 2 servers the line quickly gets crazy and makes a 35min wait for a beer.   They need to have 4 times the number of taps and servers.  While the beer line is long and snaking outside, the food line is non-existent. Then there is a poor decision that all food must be ordered from the bar (the big line). BUT somehow you can pay cash and get a pretzel. Huh?!?!  One should be able to order food from the food cart without having to do it through the bar. Thats just plain silly.  I want to like this place but management needs to get their act together cause otherwise its a poor experience.

97BHRNfBqubPqisKmj46Ww.review_text: fun time to eat/drink with old friends and make new ones  waited out the line til opening which seems to be the pattern, at least its not the hurry up to wait scene  was able to leverage other half of table to a group of 4 that was kind enough to let us add on to their beer order which is key as the line recycles for rd 2.  like a new D1 recruiting class they move on as a set of friendly ivy educated gals who work private equity sit down and laugh at our dumb jokes.  this city is diverse alright  the pretzel, sliders, pickled eggs and veggies were great.  both dames and dudes restrooms have urinals   people are friendly (staff / patrons) as its hard to be mean nor grumpy drinkin beer out of giant gustos while baskin in the sun  get your people together and head over

-Cfdld6UqO6rx72WNE9yvg.review_text: Get your dranken on! A nice day in Sacramento can turn a little chilly in SF. I was in the area and was looking for a place for lunch and a good buzz. Biergarten is mostly outdoors. I love how their facilities are shipping containers. A container for the kitchen, a container for the bathroom, one for the bar. The German themed establishment had beers I've never had or even heard of. I love beer, Biergarten has beer, I love Biergarten! I got my nephew an almdudler which was pretty good too. Tastes like lemon soda, but gooooood lemon soda. The sea dog was really good. A long weiner nestled between a soft warm hearty bun with bacon, masago, and some white stuff on top. The devilled eggs, curry potatoes, n pork belly sliders were forgettable. I wish they could lower their prices a little and figure out the parking situation better. Overall this place is GREAT!!

ZqsPaSa6ks-T5R2H6dSPQA.review_text: Fun outdoor beer garden with tasty beer and yummy sausages.  Even on a rainy, dreary day, expect this place to be filled to the brim and quite busy. The selection of beer is not extensive but enough to accommodate different palates. Our favorite was the currywurst which was a sausage with a delicious spicy tomato sauce, perfect in the cold.  Will definitely come here again, although it'd be nice if their beer was a little more reasonably priced.

qNrHLZPurBWJzeAMkFLvvA.review_text: Biergarten is quite an amazing find. Whoever thought of this concept is pretty genius. Perfect on a sunny day and of course I went during the coldest/cloudiest/windiest days ever, but those 1L beers make up for anything short of having a good time.   Grab a bunch of buddies, get 1L beers, a big pretzel each, and drink your miseries away! Bathroom is pretty fancy porta-potty with a shared sink complete with mirror. Communal picnic benches that you can easily swoop by busting out your eagle eyes.   P.S. Bring a jacket. Biergarten, can you get some heat lamps up in there?!

LYnRWJtNtQ84g0r4lkD_Gg.review_text: Came here sometime last fall with my friends who wanted to check it out.  The concept of the place is cool; they try to replicate the atmosphere of a German beer garden with authentic benches and mugs.  They even have blankets out; a good amenity to have given the chilly nights in San Francisco.  However, in terms of their food and drink, I have mixed feelings.  In all honesty, the food there is overpriced.  I ordered the bratwurst with sauerkraut; the food was really good, however they should at least give two brats instead of only one if they charge $9.  The sauerkraut was one of the best i've ever tried... not like your typical type found at ballparks.  My friend ordered the egg sandwich (costing $8) , and he was still hungry after finishing it. On the other hand, their beers are moderately priced. A 1/2 liter will cost you around $6-8, and they have a good selection of beers. I tried the Stiegl Pilsner and it was great!  All in all, this place is definitely worth trying at least once, just pick an evening/night that's not too cold.

WQ41N9RsEa8I1HVivYo3iQ.review_text: I like this place.  It's chill, fun & reminds me of the biergartens in Germany.  *heart* *review on food & service  Beer:  dunno....  didn't try any.  But the steins are stellar.    Food: Pretty tasty/fancy for a biergarten.  Was kinda hoping for schnitzel.  ; )   I got pulled pork sliders & root salad.  All very tasty.  - B+  Atmosphere: Picnic tables in an enclosed area.  Good for small to medium sized groups.  We had 10?   Great place to hang out outside w/ friends, drink & be merry.   Card games are fun!  Some Cards against humanity anyone??    Service: Slow.  Not sure why, but takes awhile for them to pour your beer... i.e. the lines moves very slowly.    Verdict: Great for a warm, sunny day.  Get there early b/c it fills up quickly!

4T2uVlRjkl0eogswfL2bTA.review_text: Love this place! The reason I only give 4 stars is due to the extremely long lines. Buy the biggest beer you can because you won't want to get back in line!   I recommend coming here on a nice day because everything is outside with little shade and no overhangs. They have a great German beer selection and a small menu with daily specials! I tried the Beet salad which was very tasty and generous size. I also tried the Pork belly sliders, amazing!   I came here with a group of friends, we all showed up a different times and had to stand in line for over a 1/2 hour. We never went back for seconds because the line never died down.   Overall, great weekend day drinking spot!

ZLQ1n8V73c0fthbQHsJhWw.review_text: this place really knows what's what. the focus is on quality beers, food, and service, and it really delivers. today we drank huge beers under umbrellas while the rain pounded Hayes, and it was a ridiculously fine experience. the staff even brought us freebie pretzel thingies for sticking it out! can't ask more from a Biergarten. don't need to lust after visiting Munchen any more.

jD1810QDa6evTCPylHqmVg.review_text: let me echo the thoughts of others: this place has great potential! beer is delicious, but pretzels do cost a bit too much ($4).  no reason also why the beer staffers could not add more people behind the bar to keep the line down.  other that that, though, really nice experience!  especially when it gets warmer, this place will be hot!

UhTzZNatDswuxf5BMNaiWw.review_text: My first review on Yelp. I found this place while going to Suppenkuche about a block away and I saw all the tables and people drinking those giant steins of beer and I was immediately intrigued. I just had to go there to see for myself. We stood in line for about 20 minutes because they were controlling the flow of people going into the area and making sure it wasn't getting crowded near the bar and food service stations. The wait was well worth it minus the fact that they were out of 3/6 beers they had available. Given it is the end of Oktoberfest, they should have been more prepared especially since it was only about 6pm and they opened at 3pm earlier that day. All that aside, I got myself a monster stein of Paulander Oktoberfest and I loved it. It's a pretty malty beer with slight hops, its an amber ale so expect it to be a little richer than a pilsner but less than a brown ale. Overall a great beer, although it's only in season during Oktoberfest. I'd definitely go here again because the ambiance and good vibes are worth it.

OFi92Xc2QyIr787GNKtgZA.review_text: If I wake up on the weekend & notice the sky is sunny, one thought immediately races through my head. "Today will be a GREAAAT DAY for BIERGARTEN!"  Yes, it's literally a parking lot with some benches & lights being hung overhead, with beer & german food being served out of shipping containers, but it's so AWESOME.   On a sunny day in Hayes, it's hard to beat chilling and drinking beer with your friends and other locals in a communal outdoor setting. The one liter steins, brimming with beer certainly encourage feelings of joy as you bs the rest of your afternoon away with friends till your hungry. I mean sure, you can be productive with your day but why would you?  Meat knot? What's that? I don't care. It tastes good & bring me another stein please.  If you can't get enough of Biergarten, you should check out their sister restaurant Suppenkuche which is also in the neighborhood. They have delicious food and DAS BOOT, two whole liters of beer ready to help you stay tipsy. Watch the movie "Beerfest" for inspiration.

bovY56Nmb3_aSFf0RJ0gfw.review_text: In another city this place would go out of business. The only reason they stay open is you can sit outside. But who in there right mind is going to wait in line for over 30 minutes for one beer. If you plan on going and having one beer and being surrounded by people just waiting to take your set come here. If you drink more then two beers in one sitting this place is not for you as you might as well just order your beer and then get in the back of the line and get ready to wait to order your second. Plus they jam you in like cattle and if you show up after it has been open then get ready to wait for 30 minutes for beer and if you have more then 4 people with you get ready to wait another 20 for a table so almost an hr to get a beer and sit down.

kZe2CUs-9OeIViFa6QC0wA.review_text: Really fun place to go for beers on a nice fall SF day. The food is surprisingly really good. I did not expect that at all given that it's located in a chained up parking lot and seems to be more of a place to go for drinking than eating, but I was wrong! The only issue I have is that it's such a popular spot, the beer line can be very long and it's frequently hard to find a seat!

FysDiqCS1fxxwC9PLHNqNg.review_text: Authentic Bavarian food in Biergarten filled with French people tonight. Which is to say: Perfect for me!

AsGl4aoGFlizHTE-IPB5eQ.review_text: This place has great beers on tap, and some decent food. The lines can be ridiculous, however. It is a great place to spend a warm Saturday afternoon!

1yRxNijLVY6IKFHZIo_ynQ.review_text: You gotta ask yourself one question. "Do I feel like getting wasted?" Well do ya? Punks!   The biergarten is a great place for someone to get hammered. Just kidding. The line itself takes about 45 minutes so naturally the first question I asked myself was "2 steins or 1." It's very important you see because 2 balances the very fine art of being happy and off your chair hammered and 1 is "oh i am definitely going to be sober by the time i get my second one."  I opted for two steins. It was an absolutely wonderful decision and the sun was shining brighter than it had before I started drinking.   So point of the story. Don't be a wuss and double fist some steins. I promise it isn't lonely on the floor.   Five stars for atmosphere (cute as hell), beers, food, bathrooms (so cute). Minus one for the line that put me in that awful 2v1 predicament in the first place.

cPR7YT7uuxDSlhbh7zkS3A.review_text: Having just returned from a trip to Oktoberfest in München I am glad to find a place serving authentic flair with good beer.   The people are real, the beer is fresh and cold, and the neighborhood is friendly.   Since this is my first review I don't have much to compare to...but if you're looking for a place that's more about who you're with than where you're at (anywhere in the world). This is a great spot!

53PjYuZ4KJgiYNUnrG75hQ.review_text: A bit pricey but it's a great place to kick it with a few good friends.   I wanted to hang out with a good friend of mine and celebrate the end of her exams. We wanted to go somewhere with alcohol. Somewhere in the city. She then stumbled upon an article on Thrillist that mentioned something about beer served by the liter...and that's how I found myself at Biergarten.   We thought we arrived early. To our surprise, there was already a pretty substantial line of hipsters and it was a bit of a wait to find a seat.   Admittedly, I'm not exactly a fan of most of the beers they serve here (more of a fan of American craft beers), but considering the venue, I wouldn't want to drink anything other than German beer. They do have a limited tap list. You can probably find something you'll like, though. As for me, I was really looking forward to drinking a dunkel (dark lager) since I haven't had a dunkel beer in a while, but they were out. Ended up with a liter of Schneider-Weisse ($16) which was okay. My friend and I also split the pork belly sliders ($9). The bread was fluffy, buttery, and nicely done. I really am a stickler when it comes to choosing the right bread for a sandwich and Biergarten did it right! The pork was tender and pretty flavorful. I liked that red cabbage slaw too. Overall, it was a great slider but not very filling for the price.   As for the seats, unless you are in a large group, you're probably going to be sharing one of those tables with a group of strangers.   Oh. And if you want another beer or more food, you'll have to fall back in line...which wouldn't be that big of a deal if the lines weren't so long.   Anyway, this place is pretty cool. I'll definitely come back for another liter and maybe one of those delicious looking prezels since the weather is nice right now.  If you're interested in getting some small german bites with large steins of german beer and  don't mind waiting in line or paying high prices, then I recommend that you stop by sometime!

5qgJTus1l35A6bqW2fFk0w.review_text: Fun spot in the middle of Hayes Valley.  The beer (tried the Helles) was delicious and comes in sizes of 0.5 or 1 L depending on how big you want to go ;) The food menu is full of fun, creative bites.  The line to get beer does get pretty long when it's crowded (aka any semi-sunny afternoon), but the bartenders are all friendly and take the time to tell you about the beers and sample different types regardless.  Fun place for groups & perfect to wander around Hayes before or after.

a7yb2m6qp9Te9TGu4B-Jxg.review_text: Don't go here unless you like to wait 45-60 min for your first and perhaps only beer. Poorly planned and executed. I waited over an hour (out of stubborn determination I guess) for one beer then would have had to wait another hour for a second round since they have no wait staff. I couldn't understand why it should take so long. Basically they have a monopoly on nice weather otherwise one would see it's just a parking lot selling $14 Stellas. Don't waste your time.

ra3OzaxpILytSjHRRKoT8g.review_text: At three p.m. on a Friday, the place was hopping.  The special frankfurter was amazing (with a special apple slaw).  Hefeweisen on tap, and all is right with the world.

s8nkbQAlrVPfg1u4anGKtw.review_text: The hours here are the worst. That's the only drawback I've found -- except for the bizarre drunk idiots that accosted us several times. But I just kind of have that vibe I guess.  The beer was great, the pretzels with their home ground mustard and pickles were savory and different, the white wine was bearable. We sat out in the biergarten in the california sunshine *and then rain* and enjoyed a cold mug of beer and some super friendly service from the folks behind the bar. It's a bit on the pricey side -- but then isnt everything in CA?   If you're in the area, and the line isnt wrapped around the block, sit down, have a beer, look at the world passing you by.

KIUeZpqA5DpQZIhcBwQVvQ.review_text: We came here yesterday (Thursday) for happy hour knowing that it had just opened last week and were expecting a crazy line. We strolled up around 6pm and there was no line to get in! Prime HH time and no line? :)  The line for beer was kinda long, but moved quickly. We ordered our steins of authentic hofbrau beer and found a picnic table for six. The crowd was really chill and respectful- no drunken, beer splashing younguns like I had expected.   Food wise, I only had a pretzel. Overpriced and skipable. I do want to try a bratwurst next time though.  The staff were awesome.. cheerful and always making sure to shoot you a smile if you walked by them.  My brit husband who lived in Germany for a year gives Biergarten his beer loving stamp of approval- that makes it 5 stars alone right there.

Szg--2wonu3BEdIav_vbCw.review_text: A nice little place by the park in Hayes Valley.  So if you like the taste of beer, don't get the one with Lemon Soda (Radler I believe), I thought it might be interesting but it was just a very smooth blue moonish like bear, very weak and not a very strong flavor at all. The other beers are better. If you want to avoid the taste of beer, then the Radler is a nice compromise.  Also, cash only + the beer won't get you drunk. It's the weakest stuff I've ever had.  Otherwise the Bratwurst and Sauerkraut are damn good.   Try to grab some blankets.

_SfuntzDyr-DuEKe1pcY1w.review_text: This place is pretty rad! A little pop up beer garden in the middle of the neighborhood. I dig it! Long lines, but serving large steins of beer out of shipping containers is awesome in it's own right. Big tables, kids, dogs and lots of people. Will definitely be back!

VmlShd8k2tq7-O4TVx5R1Q.review_text: Pretty good place to just hang out. Waiting in line is not so bad but lookig for a seat can be challenging especially when it's crowded  It's like winning a gold when you finally notice someone leaving and you quickly swoop on their seat! Whee!  Pilsner is pretty good. I only had the .5L and that was enough for me. My friend for the beef and cheese knot. Pretty good but didn't know it was going to be a sandwich. Lol.  Would come here again to hang out. Love being out in the city!

REWjbYaUkmGw04lNZraeQA.review_text: My group of friends have been hyping up this place for a very long time and I finally had the chance to stop by this past Friday. In short, I was a bit underwhelmed by my experience at Biergarten. If you hate crowds as much as me, get ready to test your patience. I was lucky enough to secure a table for my group before the crowds started to form, but if you're not lucky, you're gonna be standing for your entire stay here. Beer here only comes in two sizes - half liters and liters, and the selection is quite poor. Food selection is also quite poor, but that wasn't a big deal to me since I normally just order beer and pretzels. My take on the pretzels? Subpar. You will find pretzels that are 10 times better than the ones here at Jamber. Random aside, but I do find it a bit comical that biergarten and smittens are right next to each other, as both places very much overhyped. What perfect neighbors! For happy hour, I would look elsewhere.

CctbRY_g64_UvKOc6jmBNQ.review_text: I came here on a Friday afternoon/evening and apparently I lucked out that bit was somewhat chilly because my friend and I were actually able to get a seat. I've been told this place is usually packed.   I love the layout and vibe. It is very casual and relaxed. Get a beer, order some snacks, drink and catch up with friends. Gotta love the big steins.   My one knock is the line to order drinks. I'm a fan of orderly single queues, like chipotle. Here there were a couple of lines, a mesh of people to together and others just lolly gagging. Make one line and it is empirically proven to be faster and more efficient. This is a win win for both consumers and the business.

-Za2ZO9GMIT2kKj65G6n5Q.review_text: I was disappointed in this place; it was way overpriced ($5 for a PRETZEL?, $8 for a beer?), way overhyped (line to get in!), and food and drink that is much better done elsewhere.  Oh you just finished your beer at Biergarten and want another one?  Well, you gotta get up from your table, then stand in a long line for about 10-15 minutes just to buy your ass another beer.  There is an ARMY of staff waiting around to snatch your empty food baskets as SOON as you finish eating, but they apparently can't bring you a fresh beer (like they can in a REAL German biergarten).  Hey, let me finish the last bits of kraut before you yank that basket away, will ya?  They have a handful (3-4) of German beers on tap that you can get in massive-sized glasses if you want (bitte, $15!).  Toronado and Rosamunde Sausage Grill (the one on Mission) have the same or better selection of these types of German beers.  Even The Uptown on Capp St. usually has some nice Paulaners.  As for the food, the sausage was undercooked (still pink on the inside!) and didn't even come with a bun -- for $9!.  Rosamunde Sausage Grill's sausage is ten times better at 2/3 the price.  Heck, Rosamunde's BUN is by itself better than anything I had at Biergarten.  Aside from offering opportunity to drink outside like Zeitgeist, which frankly does everything much better (upscale people are just afraid of the bathrooms there), this place offers nothing.  This is just another overhyped pseudo foodie place in SF.    You can find me at Rosamunde when I want a German sausage and a German beer (yes, they often even have Kostrizter Schwartzbier).  It's better (the kraut is even better, nicely seasoned with juniper berries), cheaper, and less hassle, and no wait to get in, no ridiculous 15-20 minute line to buy another beer.   The Mission location even has outside seating.  Biergarten is proof that you can take mediocre food, a handful of common German beers that are available elsewhere, overprice it all by 50% and STILL have people lining up because you put the whole thing outside -- on a slab of parking lot asphalt surrounded by a chainlink fence.  "Oh, we have a biergarten in SF... how Europeannnnnn!"

LpVJ7DQ0K7qqIqDw_jMdTg.review_text: I came to Biergarten for a quick bite but quickly made friends in the outdoor friendly atmosphere.  I ordered the bratwurst with a tangy sauerkraut and spicy brown mustard on pretzel bread.  When my sausage arrived it protruded out of both sides of the short pretzel bun, which kind of reminded me of the Scandinavian hot-dogs.  This allowed me to taste the meat, which was very tasty.  I was pleased to find the heaping amount of sauerkraut on top and paired with the mustard and freshly baked pretzel bun I was in heaven.    I'm sad to say I didn't stay long enough to grab a beer but the selection looked more than adequate and I'm sure would go very well with the food.  I'll be back to try something else and drink up for last time!

YR0CcWbSasHEVoXzjCTREQ.review_text: The Hayes Valley biergarten is a great place to spend a sunny day.  Get there early to beat the huge crowds, and pay attention to the somewhat odd hours they keep.  Afterwards, Hayes Valley is a pleasant neighborhood to walk around in.

zciwU82jK43PULjH6b_t2g.review_text: A very solid Beer Garden with very good beer.  Went here with a group of 10 friends to celebrate a birthday.  We got there after the rest of the group, so they already had a table and were pretty far up in line.  That being said, it is busy on a Saturday afternoon in the fall and the line moves very slowly.  Had we not taken turns waiting in line, the experience would have been a lot less enjoyable.  But it's a beer garden and we got exactly what we expected - overly large beers, German food, and nice outdoor seating.

l-zgWG-brcQ4iRev-pfrsg.review_text: Baby became cranky when they couldn't get into Suppenkuche.  So, they brought baby to the biergarten for brats and beer. Daddy chugged down a lager.  Mommy wolfed down the pretzel.  They shared a basket of sauerkraut, bratwurst, and yes, another pretzel.  Baby didn't get brats or beer, but fell asleep dreaming about them, so Mommy and Daddy were extra happy, too.

WJfNVm4mXXDt1Vakg13CpA.review_text: First of all, I have to say the whole concept of a "beer garden" is freaking awesome! Biergarten is exactly what its name implies, which is essentially an casual, fun outdoors gastropub that serves up an eclectric menu of German favorites like Bratwurst with fresh pretzles, maple syrup bacon bread pudding and wide array of drinks. They are currently in the process of expanding the business so expect longer hours during the coming summer. My friend and I had very fortunately stumbled upon Biergarten on our way to Chantal Guillon for macaroons, while waiting to be seated for dinner. Both of us decided to return after our dinner reservation for late night (~7pm) spirits and snacks. Although they were bustling with people around dinner time, the crowd began to thin down when we got there...so there was no line and plenty of blankets, seating available. And now I can proudly say that we were very happy with this decision!  There were 2 draft beers, 2 wines offerings that evening with several snacks. We decided on a white dessert wine, Pilsner and maple syrup bacon bread pudding to share. Everything was delicious, although the bread pudding was a little burnt at the bottom. Our Pilsner was big enough to be shared between the two of us. The warmly lit ambiance and complimentary blankets offered a nice shelter against the chilly winter night, overall making the scenery extremely sweet and comfortable...to the extent in which I ended up taking a short nap amidst our talking, snacking and drinking. Overall, it was the icing on top of great evening. Even though I didn't eat here...judging by the hungry bites my fellow customers were taking, the menus would definitely be worth exploring! The portions of their entrees may not filling enough for dinner but would serve as generous snacks to pair with drinks. I would say that this is a great place to for a laid-back hangout with friends on a weekday night, after work, or weekend. Good choice! Will definitely be returning with more friends

OjTmPLbMUJGK8fybeK3DOg.review_text: Don't like hipsters? Don't go to the Biergarten. Instead, move to Stockton and stop complaining. If you're less concerned about the appearance of your servers and fellow customers, read on:  The food is great, albeit expensive. The bier is terrific (also expensive). Show up with eyes open about the cost, enjoy the company of your group instead of complaining about the line and you'll have a great time.

kaGiZgqbnA22BespaMFF3A.review_text: 4+. Good beer, good to awesome food (pink deviled eggs! and sunflower-seed pretzels with fresh horseradish, etc.) The salad basket is a real bargain.  Today they had a somewhat interesting ice-sculpture that everyone was instagraming. Hipster and self-aware? Hell yeah, and I don't care. I can ignore them as easily as I can ignore anyone else. They are somewhat quietly loathing themselves while I am quietly enjoying my food. It's a win-win in out parallel universes. An occasional neutrino upsets the balance.

gvQCzJO8LGIyLNnARr-IJg.review_text: With limited options for drinking beer outside in San Francisco, the Biergarten delivers and delights.  Tough to beat on a nice, sunny day.  The small menu of delicious food offerings makes it easy to waste a way an entire afternoon (and bank account - 1-liter beers run close to $20).   Don't expect to catch the game here - no TV of any sort. In my eyes, a fifth star comes when you don't have to choose between the game and the Biergarten.

Sw7leO4Xw-tvg4CiIISxCw.review_text: I enjoyed everything about this place. Sure the food and beer add up but you are outside in a decent neighborhood and if you have good friends around you the money doesn't matter. First off liter sized beers, OK! Amazing bratwurst and sauerkraut, GREAT! When it gets chilly the wool blankets come out, PERFECT! Overall yes the bill added up but the atmosphere and friends around with good beer and food to choose from this is a place that I will recommend to others.

eSU_HjKOA3Ppt8oS07oYkw.review_text: A few friends and I came to Biergarten after Suppenküche was packed to the brim. We were still feelin' the German beers, and the weather was perfect outside, so we staked our claim on one of the picnic tables. We got there around 9pm and it wad still pretty crowded, but we managed to find a free table pretty easily.   The outdoor space is pretty cool, with a few shipping container type structures, serving beer and assorted German sausages, pretzels, and other bar food. We ordered our beers, and I ordered the pork belly sliders, which were delicious, including the red cabbage slaw it came with. I would recommend against getting the burger, because although it was delicious as well, it was about the size of one of my sliders and more expensive. The waitstaff is very friendly and they were very efficient with bringing out the food.  I love the raucous beer gardens where everyone is singing and having a good time, but after being a plane for 6 hours, I definitely appreciated how laid-back and chill Biergarten was. If you're looking for an Oktoberfest-type experience, Biergarten might not be the place you're looking for.  The only disappointing thing was how early it closes. 9pm seems a bit early, but I guess, as a sort of a pop-up beer garden, you have to be mindful of the surrounding neighborhood. Anyways, I'm a big fan, and I'll definitely be back for some good German fare and delicious beers.

kRuLPE8TTtWeB2shWQi69Q.review_text: Really fun vibe! ! You really feel like you're at an outdoor pub in Germany. The food was fantastic. The sliders were literally the best sliders I've ever had. Pretzel was good, the horseradish was a nice compliment. Seating is limited and although the wait wasn't bad when we went at 5pm, the line was super long as I was leaving. Had the cider beer which was delish and heard no complaints about the others on tap as well. Definitely will be back.

SKQld0XdYNrGJU8DSlR3KQ.review_text: My favorite bar in SF, specially on a nice sunny afternoon. There is usually a longgg line but trust me, its worth the wait. Their bites are delicious. A bit pricy for the size but  they are delicious.

UE-rXhA8njNnADFkDA3EuA.review_text: Pricey small dishes (open-face egg sandwich, bratwurst). Good place to chill with beer and friends on a sunny day.

H3PFTHE-SL1gg2exnNy1jg.review_text: A good time is always had at Beirgarten. The food is good, the beer is good, but the tables are always full on a good day and the line will be around the gate and out the door.
