I wish they could expand, but I understand that they are limited to their corner lot.  Despite the mass amount of people on a nice day/night, the beer is always good, always changing, and always worth the wait. Check it out!

5vXqog3DHrRXADKUg78B2w.review_text: Pro tip: on a night when the Hayes Valley Off the Grid pod is set up just on the other side of the fence (offthegridsf.com/pods), the kind folks at Biergarten will allow you to enjoy your food truck grub on their turf as long as you purchase some beers. And, quite frankly, why wouldn't you when presented with such an opportunity? Long live Proxy SF! proxysf.net

-Ryl_0mZE_71CMPIcbzZhg.review_text: My favorite beer garden in the city.  On one of those rare sunny days we enjoy in the city, this is where you can find me. The main event is of course the bier, which you can get in either a half pint size or a 1 liter size (stein). There isn't a huge selection of beers, maybe 5 or 6, and I always get the wheat Schneider Edel-Weisse. There is also a few options when it comes to food fare. There are pickles, bratwursts, frankfurts, pretzels and pork belly sliders. The sliders are outrageously delicious, I highly suggest you order them.  The beer garden is set up with a bunch of cafeteria style lunch tables. It can be hard to find a spot to sit on a busy weekend. On colder days, they offer blankets for customers.

0cZaLvThOfuQa9spTMyv8g.review_text: Biked here with a friend one day, and was ready for some food and drinks.   We got in line, which wasn't very long. Just enough time to decide on some food and drinks.   + They have one of my favourite beers on tap! Schineider Nelson Sauvin. It's an amazing beer with a nice floral-esque nose AND flavour to it. I ended up getting two of these. + The food was decent. Better than average, but not amazing. The prices were reasonable, not that expensive, and accurately reflected the value food.  ++ We got pork belly sliders, deviled eggs, and a pretzel. They were all fairly delicious. The deviled eggs are pink!  When we went up for round two of beers, the queue was fairly long and it was quite a wait. Seating is definitely hard. They have plenty of seats, but this place gets packed and popular!  I cannot comment on parking because I biked.  There is no real "service" happening here. You buy your beer and then you sit down. Food is brought to you, and your tables bused. Very little interaction, so we'll keep that neutral. It's actually better that way so you can quality time talking with friends without being interrupted.   Good beers, decent food, reasonable prices. Will return when they come back from vacation, and I recommend this place!

FSDj4JOrZxd5Z-ax15Klgg.review_text: Didn't know about this place till my friend invited me down. I always pass this place off of 101 on to Octavia. It's kind of like, Munich meets steel shipping container land. The bathrooms, the vending areas, shipping containers. Luckily the seating/picnic tables (which BTW, after 4pm is nonexistent) are not.  It was a pretty nice day in San Francisco, OK it was 56F. Line already formed by 4...it took about 15 minutes to get to the front of the queue. They were out of the Bratwurst, but we ordered pork sliders, beef tongue, Asahi (BTW, it was Japanese themed today...is this a Japan/Germany/Axis thing?) and Edelweiss. All for about $40bucks.  Lucky for us, I found some milk crates to fashion a makeshift table and seats. Ate our dinner, froze our butts and a couple left a table, and we jumped on it.  Overall a very nice experience to chat, eat and drink a brew or five.

gfjgoJ_ERWzp8JbmlYo_bA.review_text: So much love for this place. It's basically my backyard. The food is fantastic (I prefer the alarmingly pink deviled eggs, and the pretzel-wich with brie and picked shallots), the bathrooms are some of the cleanest I've *ever* seen (tip: they're marked as Mens and Womens in name only so no worries using the other gender's bathroom for efficiency's sake.) Oh yeah, and they have beer, too! Lots and lots of lovely delicious beer.  The only thing I could possibly ask for is more beer options. And earlier opening hours. And some chairs for lounging with a book. Just small things.

WNBLzzSRaAYT12YFfXjJ0Q.review_text: Food was amazing, beer is cold and refreshing. Friendly and fast service. Great place to spend an afternoon with friends.  The cider is crisp and refreshing without being too sweet. The sausage platter is fantastic.  The pretzel is served with horseradish and mustard, and the pickles are fresh and crisp.

_mfVg2apfsD8BIpgCMoIig.review_text: Great place to go and enjoy the patio. Like everything in the city expect a line but, if you have cash you can grab a pretzel or a pickle while you wait. Prepare to sit with strangers and have a giant beer.   The food prices are reasonable and most everything was good. The knot was my fave but, the mustard was intense and dominated the taste of the braut and deviled eggs.  All and all worth the wait it takes.

hCLGgtfo4bCXOzGNuYHvdQ.review_text: Super soft bloody beef, topped with some snappy rocket. Brioche buns are the way to my heart, but the thing that really did it for me: deep fried onions. Thank the Lord.  As far as Biergartens go, this place is totally unauthentic and the prices are bordering on the clinically insane. However, it is a great place to hang out and I would recommend it to anyone in the area.

IUXmQbiQSG97Aez2rOKmcQ.review_text: This is touch because this is a pretty unique establishment and i dig the concept but the line is unreal sometimes! Good beer though and the $4 pretzel I tried was pretty good. Delicious when warm but it got so cold that my pretzel didn't take too long to get cold too :(  +1 for bringing out blankets to everyone when it got colder. That was nice :)  Unfortunately weather is a huge factor in how enjoyable this place will be for me...Unless you have an alcohol blanket on, which can be difficult with the long lines!

dl7TdXUL0aybDbSHuwOU0w.review_text: Recommended by friend while in SF. Quality of food/bev (8/10). Relative value (9/10). They basically sell you a liter of beer for $12. How many beers in a liter? wiki.answers.com/Q/How_m… That comes out to about $4.00 per beer. That's a pretty good value. Plus it looks pretty cool hoisting those oversize beer steins. Ambience: This place is basically an empty lot covered in black asphalt and park benches (rumored to have been flown in straight from Germany). The two buildings are basically converted storage containers. You sit where you can, and usually random people share tables. Me likey as fun social place. They day we went there was also a band playing dressed in funny german outfits. I heard they volunteer and get paid in beer. Only four beers on tap and very limited menu, but if you're going to be picky about those types of things, go to a sit down resturatant or the Yard House. I'd probably give this 4.5 stars mainly for the value, and the social aspect of this place. Fun times.

vhCzEMJ-XDTuJflaYTHRzw.review_text: The space is great but the beers on tap are limited.  With only 3 beers to choose from, I was disappointed.  I love german beers and wanted to see a variety, so that gives this establishment only 3 stars.

vTn9a3bCNK8S6uxEq9ZaCw.review_text: I love the idea and concept but massive lines and fighting for seating when it get packed is frustrating. It gets packed on every sunny day which is awesome for business and I get you can't really expand but waiting for 20/30 minutes for a 8-14 beer can convince people to move. Still enjoy stopping by every so often.

jZqwsvfNPM68IV8UO8RVpg.review_text: Beer gardens are down right awesome. If I lived in SF, I'd come here every weekend with friends!  They had a good selection of beer and food. I wanted a light beer so I ordered the Radler (half Lager, half Lemon soda). I really enjoyed it and would get it again! My friend got the Schneider Weisse which was also good. In terms of food we got the Pork Belly Sliders and Meat Knot (pretzel and pastrami) which were both delicious!   Blankets are also provided for when it gets too chilly. How accommodating is that!

Cfdj06EDOKvaeLHkUfKv_A.review_text: Beers, check. Snacks, check. Fun atmosphere and blankets for the city's chilly days, check.

RR-hNSxTUs4CSkGQZLEWyw.review_text: My boyfriend heard of Biergarten from his brother and confirmed it with one of the servers at Suppenküche. We came here the weekend of my birthday. Although there was quite a line, it wasn't too bad of a wait. The prices are still just as high here, even their bar food was a bit pricey. However, I enjoyed their beer and of course enjoyed my company, my PIC and drinking buddy. Cannot wait to bring my friends here!

mi8LdMhA5MS_9HK8U6C-2A.review_text: Actual rating: 3.75 / 5 stars  This place is an awesome place to go to.... if you bring all your friends with you and drink lots of beer with lots of obnoxious people. Nice place, since it's closed off across a park with lot of good stores around.   Don't get me wrong, the beer is awesome. They don't have a huge selection of beer, but whatever they do have is very good. The food here is expensive for a "food-truck" type of food, so try to come here not on an empty stomach. You shouldn't drink with an empty stomach anyway. I had the 2 sausages combo with pretzel for $18. The 1L beer is about $10. Sausages was ok, pretzel was good. Beer was excellent.   So wear a jacket, layer, prepare to wait in line, bring lots of friend, come with good stories to tell and just be loud. Don't bring your date here. Unless it's a group thang and you like to talk to random groups of the same type of people.

wm7jnUwj5spDjFkX_JMnRA.review_text: "German beer in a glass stein on a sunny Saturday afternoon in San Francisco" is an oddly specific answer to give when someone asks what my favorite color is.  Oddly specific, long-winded, and tedious, but honest.  Your first priority should not be getting a table, going to the bathroom, or waiting for friends - it should be getting in line for your beer. My friend and I made the novice mistake of commandeering seats and taking lavatory breaks and suffered the consequences: forty minutes in line waiting to order our drinks. The sun beat down on the back of my neck and ears, freckling my face in a very un-German way as I gazed enviously at the wise folks already sipping their authentic Bavarian brews from steins so full and so heavy they had to be lifted with two hands.  Despite the wait, this place is glorious. Beer (German-brewed tongue-twisters in name and in flavor) comes in liters or half-liters, both of which stay surprisingly, blissfully cold no matter how long it takes you to polish them off. Traditional German fare includes pretzels with horseradish and sharp mustard, sliders, and bright, pickled seasonal things (eggs, grapes, carrots, and cabbage are common menu tenants). You'll probably end up sharing a table community-style with some pretty chill people; you'll probably really wished you'd paid attention in high school German; you'll probably want to go back again next weekend.

7wUczg1-5F3JxkZoRxisqw.review_text: Loved it!  4-5 taps of German beer. A little pricey but oh-so-good. Bartenders were very nice. Great that they accept credit cards.   We managed to find a table pretty easily on a Friday afternoon (4th of July weekend). One of the girls in our group ordered the pretzel knot with cheese and it looked SO good. We were getting dinner at Suppenkuche later on that night or else I would've ordered some food. It all looked quite good.  Will come back again! It was so cold this time, but maybe next time I'll pay Smitten a visit too!

7ecvBHMwf8xoJPL2AA3MoA.review_text: After circling the neighborhood for a good 30 mins to find parking, seeing the line to get the beer was ridiculous. But I'm glad to say it was worth the wait. I was very surprised to see the only 2 sizes the beers came in, .5L and 1L but they were well worth it for the price.  We tried the haufbrau, octoberfest, and one other one, grabbed a few pretzels and chatted the afternoon away with some new friends we made at one of the picnic tables. Really wanted to give the bratwurst a try because they smelled amazing but we had to save room for dinner. Overall, great atmosphere and a great place to hang out with friends and meet new ones.

9Obo2dAKY1wucMxlU2jUfw.review_text: Despite the long wait to get your beer, the environment definitely makes up for it. The vibe is super chill and relaxing, mostly consisted of either people who've just got off work and people celebrating a rare sunny SF afternoon.    Came with 7 people on a Friday afternoon, the line was already forming outside to the sidewalk by 430PM. Waited about 20 minutes in line as the others grabbed a table. Getting the table and the actual beer was both instant, which was very nice. I have yet to try the food here, but from the things I was smelling, it's definitely worth a try.   The entire "garden" area was pretty packed the entire time, started getting pretty full by 7PM. The line for beer was against the gate, about a 35 minute wait (Don't know who would have the patience to wait that long for a beer...). The bathrooms were pretty clean (compared to your regular pub/bar around the city), ignore the men & womens signs, there's a urinal in the womens.   The beer overall was rather tasty. I had two liters of Weihenstephaner (Keep in mind that I'm a 5'1 female, so you can imagine how much you would be able to consume!), lighter ale which totally hit the spot considering how extremely sunny it was! To me, it was worth the wait and the price.   Definitely coming back here again! :)

ebgL4kFL_Ayi6Mw52EE4NQ.review_text: I really like this place, although it's a little pricey.   I can forgive them for the beer because it's imported and it's delicious, but the food is pretty steep for what you get, even though everything I've tried here has been been delicious. It's fine if you're just trying to have some snacks with your beer, but don't try to eat here for dinner when you're hungry like I did. My boyfriend and I met up here for dinner, split two things, and had to have a second dinner a couple hours later. Maybe we should've had more beer. I can appreciate that they seem to change up their menu, one time they had delicious mushroom sliders and the last time I was here they had a variety of tacos.  The ambiance is great. I've only been at night but it seems like it'd be a great spot to hang out during the day.

Ia_8Ey61yqaettBfGPBo4A.review_text: The prices, unfortunately, are entirely off the mark for my liking. For the price of a liter of beer, I'd rather go back to Germany and buy it there.  Also, I was very sad that the potato salad was mayo-based.

RQR-bncvVssevK_WIPWvCA.review_text: We visited Biergarten during quite cold weather, so we didn't have to wait in the legendary lines. The beer was awesome, as was all the food. Pretzels, mustard, pickles, sandwiches... yummmmm.  A fabulous time was had by all. Love that they provide blankets!!

k2vaxn4rBpUzJBJJQg51TA.review_text: Go for the bier, stay for the outdoor drinking experience. But eat elsewhere.   Let me explain...  The beer choices are good and you can get them in 1/2 or 1 Litre sizes, but you'll have to wait in a long line before getting to quench your thirst. The people taking your order are friendly, answer your questions, and don't rush you despite the line that keeps growing behind you (it takes a while to pour a litre of beer!).  Once you have your beer in hand, find a picnic table, kick back, and get merry.  And if you happen to get hungry, I'd visit the food trucks parked around the corner before buying food here again. On to the hugely disappointing snacks: I was looking forward to having a nice, warm German pretzel. What I got in return for my $5 was a COLD seeded pretzel with dollops of mustard and nostril-searing horseradish. F that.  Still hungry, I ordered a brat & sauerkraut for $9. Tasty, but no bun so it wasn't as filling as I was hoping. Hey, at least the brat was hot. Still, $9 for a brat is kinda crazy. Is there a ballgame going on here? They must be made from organic, virgin, nitrite-free, vegan-diet pork to justify it.  Given their overhead (or lack thereof), I'd expect lower prices across the board. But since the crowds keep on coming, I doubt they'll change anything.

SqSMWBHD2Lklf_8W5MftPA.review_text: Have wanted to go to this place for awhile now, and finally went yesterday, when the weather was beautiful out.  Unfortunately, too many people had the same idea.  The place had a good vibe and good beer, but the line to get beer was very long -- it took more than half an hour to get to the front of the line -- and while we were in line, we found out that they were out of pretzels!  This was around 5:30, and they're only open from 2-8, so that was quite disappointing.  Because of the long line, we only got one round of beers, because we didn't want to wait again.  That's not really the feeling you want when you go out to grab some beers (plural).

_IpAWG7j7AztF6oY6YF3Iw.review_text: Newly found gem for me, whoever created and opened this place is a genius.    Pros:  Outside, simple, good german eats, good german beer  Cons:  Beer line can get very long and the beer selection is slim, unlike the full liter beers they serve!

AgJxCwwC90WwUOv7g3tiXQ.review_text: Be prepared to wait in a very long line ...   This place is amazing!  And outdoor beer garden is just an awesome place to hang out and drink and have a great time with friends.  We arrived around 3pm and realized that there was already a long line that had formed to get in.  Apparently, you have to go earlier than that to stand in line.   It took us about 45 minutes to one hour before we got to the front to order and sit down.  There are limited tables and the service can be a little slow.  Not sure why they don't have separate lines for drinks only and drinks/food.  I think that was what was slowing down the line.  Plus, once you get in it might be tough to find a table as most of the tables get filled up quickly.  You might have to squeeze with other people but it makes it more fun.   We ordered a cheese pretzel to try their handmade pretzels and it was delicious!  If I had room for more food, I would've ordered more just to try everything out.  You can order different sizes for the beer so don't be scared off by the large giant mugs everyone is carrying around.  Or you might be get really excited seeing them.    Either way this is a really nice place to just sit, enjoy your beer and chat the night away.

wrsG7r7_vMjkQZutp5L1Hw.review_text: Update:  Came back here, love the beer and bites, but the bouncer was a douche.   Is this place even open?? I made plans with some friends to have a night out at Biergarten, checked the website for their hours...but when I got there they were closed! and no it was not raining.

OHMSNlCCGCpY8Z-E_EuZBw.review_text: More of these fun outdoors drinking venues should exist in the city. They serve delicious German snacks, German beer in big steins, and it's outside next to a park and across from an ice cream shop and Ritual coffee. A great place to spend a sunny afternoon.  At the very least run there for a pretzel and a beer if the weather is nice and it's not out of your way. What more could you ask for in a day-drinking spot?

amz57NX_BDfMhrJnkQhTYw.review_text: Long lines. Get a liter, you won't want to get back in line nor lose your seat (if you can grab one).    Could have a larger beer selection but I respect the German selection and the appropriate glassware.  High quality beer that won't get warm because you won't stop sipping.  Luckily I snagged a seat while my BF got the brews.  We arrived at 2:05, the place opened at 2:00 and already the entire garden was either packed or claimed for.  They need to have a no reserving seats rule, and a no sitting before you have beer rule and this might make the flow a little better.  I snagged the end of a table with a bit of begging and a bit of force, just after getting my beer, people were standing eyeing down seats.  Come early, bring friends, hold down a table and get a few liters.  Thank god the sun shines in SF in January.  Gotta love that.  **Did not try any food, review for beer and beer garden only**

f0LuZ1Nv1XtsHtPpGzaeAg.review_text: So busy but so good!!! Best beer and German bites! Mein Liblingsbiergarten!!!!!

QocP49nZ7Fo-4Rp_QxPuDQ.review_text: a German Biergarten is always a good thing! There are too many long lines to get in and order beer, but both go pretty fast. The very cool red beard bouncer either said "go find the good looking people" or "you are good looking people", either way, everyone in here looks pretty happy and good looking. The pretzels are great and the friend making group tables are a lot of fun. I was pretty cold though, maybe they are pre heat lamp operated?

6gfX-aJxO5tGjI2z4IeJOQ.review_text: First off, I wished I wasn't stuffed before I came here because the food looked and smelled awesome.  If you like your German Beers then this place will work for you. Biergarten is simply cool. The only downside is the general frigidness of S.F.   I'm only giving it four stars for the lack of space heaters. I only left because my face was frozen.

JlaG3-0Md1M63wafhNTIvA.review_text: Excellent beer, bratwurst , deviled eggs and pork belly sliders. Will try the other things on their menu soon!

D6dCpfSnSv2waqnCaGlv_w.review_text: The food comes in small portions and is a bit pricey but Biergarten keeps you coming back with great atmosphere, a live band, and fun crowd. Please skip the egg sandwich and duck fat. Order the Pork Belly Sandwich along with a side of potato salad.  A thick cut of pork belly fat grilled brown and crispy is served on a warm mini bun. I could eat 6 of these pork belly sandwiches but I guess you're suppose to get full from all the beer they have on hand. I'm not much of a beer drinker but I really loved the Lemon Soda mixed with Beer. It was sweet but still had that grainy beer taste. It was perfect for those rare sunny sf days. It gets really crowded here and seating can get a bit tight. Nothing is more disappointing than having your food and drink orders come with no place to sit at. More benches and heartier portions would really make this spot perfect.

FQj_5wqxNhQpxzBhrrlrjg.review_text: Three words.  Pork. Belly. Sliders!  I'm not a beer drinker, so this review is based on those sliders.  DE-LISH!  I'll admit they're smaller than I'm used to for sliders, and the price isn't well, let's just say I could probably buy an entree elsewhere for the price of the sliders.  BUT!  So worth trying them.  Hats off to the chef!

ubF5zarbyXJVMTOZrSUFyQ.review_text: We were on our way to Smitten and stumbled across this little gem. Even though I had given up beer (well, newly given up as a month and a half ago) and a most of us didn't drink beer, I am SO glad we did anyways! It's such a cute idea and would be an awesome place to hang out and catch up with friends in the summer. It was still winter though and a little chilly at 4PM in the afternoon, but hey. When in SF.... do what San Franciscians do right?   We waiting probably a little over half an hour to make our way to the front. The girl pouring our beer was super nice and knowledgable and informed us of the different brews they had on draft. We even got to sample a few of them! I forgot which one we got, but it was tasty. Two size options: A liter or a half. With my newly found appreciation for clean eating and giving up beer, I opted for the half. Wise choice on my behalf. *Pats on back*  By the time we all got our beers and wine, a table opened up. Score! Then it got chilly the longer we stayed out there. Probably around 5PM. The nice lady that worked there asked us if we wanted blankets. YES! Double score!   Definitely an awesome place to check out!

yrymJBFi9XPfzC4R1J34sw.review_text: Great place for a drink and a bite to eat with friends.   After we ordered and sat down, I felt like I was back in Berlin.  I love this they have all German beers on tap available in 0.5L or 1L mugs.  And the pretzel was also yummy.

9H2hvHUmEbn8nkfbu82FzQ.review_text: Not a huge selection of beer, but a great spot to hang out with friends. Its outdoors and can get chilly at times, but they provide blankets so its all good. Can get crowded so I would make sure you get there early or else you will stand around awkwardly waiting for a table. Food is good, but expensive for the portion size. Would be much better if they had some epic pretzels.

MbfrGVXuPU35K7lwZQEqVA.review_text: You can probably find me here on any given Saturday afternoon. The bier is good. The atmosphere is cool. The prices are moderate.   Sadly I have yet to try the food. I always end up getting filled up on bier and decide to stumble across the street to Smitten for an ice cream dinner.

mW8fvDQ3JAtzeLjU--CjTg.review_text: Been here twice in the past two weeks. Solid beer and food options, though slightly expensive. The bratwurst was amazing!   There's nothing special about the place though, nothing that gives it any character, that's my main complaint. But overall it's a nice place to grab a beer outside on a nice day.

-89IDABrt2vnhvoCiUlVCw.review_text: I stopped by for my regular radler and a knot, and discovered they have a cheese knot! It has caramelized onions as well, which really compliments the flavor of the cheese - it leaves it tasting very sweet (this coming from a person that hates onions.)

C6LaHeW6P1lbSwVZYkyhhg.user_location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
C6LaHeW6P1lbSwVZYkyhhg.review_text: Whether you're a local, transplant, or just visiting. The Biergarten is A MUST! They have a great variety. Try the Brass Monkey, it's like a beer-mosa and so delish. If you order the mug be warned, drunkenness is sure to follow. ;) One tip though, don't plan on this being your lunch spot. We were pretty shocked when we order a burger and sandwich and ended up with tiny sliders. So get lunch beforehand.

KgDOK0iFpD2mQsKkpvrALg.review_text: Fun!  ... with a few caveats.  First, get there within 45 minutes of it opening, which is at 2:00pm. After that time period, you're gonna be hovering over the tables like a hawk looking for a spot to rest your big ass steins. If you see a small bench spot, go ahead and ask to squeeze in. Most folks will be friendly enough to scooch a bit for you and your friends (hopefully it's just 1 or 2 only).   I'd definitely spring for an entire 1L stein.  You think you'd only be game for half a liter... but chances are you're gonna be having a fun time chatting with your friends and sitting al fresco on a warm afternoon... you'll want to stay longer and drink more.  And it sucks majorly to have to line up again... guarantee another 30 min wait.    Speaking of the wait... they need another person behind the taps! 2 cashiers can take the orders and 1 tap master can be dispensing the golden goodness.  This can hurry along the wait a lot faster.  But honestly, that'd probably fill this up really fast and there really isn't enough seats for such a big crowd.  As for the food... loved the bratwurst!  It comes with dijon mustard, horseradish that'll singe your nose hairs, and a giant heap of sauerkraut.  Though I was bit confused why it had sooo much liquid in the baskets it is served in.  That could be drained out a little better.  Brats are moist and flavorful.  The kraut was great!  I ate it like it was a side salad!  Deviled eggs were pickled in beet juice... gave it a unique sweet tang.  I added a goop of horseradish to balance it out.  Hoo wee!  Waitresses are really fast with serving the food and they're always coming around to pick up your empty dishes/glasses.  They either do that to replenish for the bar or they want to retrieve those back before it ends up in some TimBuk2 bag (yoink!).  Also, you will no doubt bust out your bad German accent during your stay here.  Auf Wiedersehen!

IfHo9BPvVpeuzY8lnJjN-A.review_text: this is one very unique place and i love how it feels on a sunny day.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: A 1/2 litre of beer and a liced laced blanket.  What else can you ask for?

KW38OXpDlH3Xd1LutwjaQA.review_text: Did you wake up this A.M. imagining yourself with some friends on a big picnic table hugging a liter krug (that's German for big ass 1 person pitcher) of a Suppenkuche beer?  Well this lil Beer Garden / Reclaimed Parking Lot complete with retrofitted industrial shipping containers is Das Shizzy! It's overflowing with all the reasons people love Suppenkuche without having to elbow wrestle yourself a beer.  Not only is it bad ass man sized beers, they got some dang good grub to boot! Like pretzels, brats, salads, and sliders! You see they've built one of the old shipping containers into a kitchen. Genius! Then they built onto it a little back patio with a fire grill. Brilliant!  Now throw in some sunny weather and you've got an afternoon of the Gods that is till one of the crazy locals decides to cozy up on your bench and kill your buzz but hey at least they're staying true to the German culture and leaving the choice of where to sit the toughest choice of all!

t9cze1D9Gb8d-spMoHHSSg.review_text: it's raining but who cares when you are at a fun beer garden right in the middle of Hayes valley. What a great idea. Outdoor seating with umbrellas on most tables and warm blankets just in case you need one. We ordered the bratwurst basket which includes 2 bratwurst, sauerkraut and a soft pretzel. Oh and yummy pork belly sandwiches (2 mini to an order)! Oh and of course a Black Logger! I feel like I'm in Germany! Extra plus, I love the friendly staff. Oh yes, they are so well equipped... outdoor kitchen and there are even very clean outdoor bathrooms (after all that beer!).

rE7YqX3KSEmJS_uf5l7S9Q.review_text: It really pains me to give this rating, but my girlfriend and I both got sick after eating here. We had an order of pickles and a pretzel while waiting in line, and later the sausages and sauerkraut. I'm guessing it was the latter that did us in. This is such a shame, because the food was surprisingly good. Fortunately, it was not too bad, and neither of us missed work.  Had it not been for the incident with the food, I'd give this place 3.5 stars, maybe 4. The biggest problem is the lines. I don't mind waiting to get into the place (the guy at the door (the owner?) was really friendly and helpful), but you have to go back into that long line to order another beer, as there is no table service nor a separate line for customers already inside. I'd also deduct a 1/2 star for lack of variety. They had Schneider Weisse (yay!), but the other two beers were ok. The Radler is way too sweet for me, but that's a personal preference I suppose. Those were the only options the day we were there.  So my take on this place? If you don't mind the lines, this is a lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon. The communal outdoor benches are great. I'll personally avoid the food, but might be back for a beer. With Schmidt's and Walzwerk not far away, however, I might just go to one of those places to get a better selection of beer.

0mP76PwDxamNMpO1qnHuhg.review_text: Beergarden...I mean, Biergarten has a great concept. Outdoor drinking, large mugs, and German eats.  It's a great way to spend a sunny afternoon in the city with some good company. The German beers come in this huge mug which is a cool idea. The beer was tasty, but if you like real beer I would recommend staying away from the beer mixed with the soda. By the halfway mark, the sweetness gets to you and it's harder to drink by the minute.   Beware that the line can get VERY long and unfortunately, it's the same line if you want another round. Ain't nobody got time for that! Maybe it's their way of crowd control so that there is not one group that stays forever unless they are really determined to wait in that line again. How do you not wait in line? Show up when Biergarten opens. There will be no line to wait in and a hopefully somewhat short one for seconds.  Unique beer, beautiful day, great company...good times.

8Tllfos1YxyhvoxiGR0CbA.review_text: There is nothing to not love about Biergarten.  Well, ok.  There is one thing.  Two things, actually.  One:  They could use more taps, especially on days when the weather is great.  Two:  the fact that their lease will be up soon. That will be a sad day when Biergarten closes it's gates for goon.   Apart from that, Biergarten is perfect.  The beer is awesome and German, with a choice of sizes.  The snacks hit the spot, perfect drinking snacks like the pretzel, my favorite.  Let the Steigl flow forever, Biergarten.  I love this garden!

bNpy0uzbh7BT2Wnd5eReTw.review_text: What a GREAT place to chill, have a beer and soak in the rare SF sunshine! I've driven by here so many times and never realized that it was a biergarten because I think the conexes kinda threw me off for something more industrial or something. My friends and I parked our butts here right when they opened at 3pm on a Wednesday and we were enjoying our Spring Break from our intense nursing school program...so we had an excuse to drink in the middle of the day in the middle of the week. For the rest of the folks there, we just had to wonder what folks did for work who drank full liter steins of beer at 3pm.  Anyway, the beer is what you'd expect to find at any fine German establishment. They rotate beers by season and pour in 0.5 liter ($10) or 1.0 liter ($20) glasses/steins. It's too bad they don't sell beer by DAS BOOT! I guess those might break too easily... The only thing that could make this place even more awesome is if the women who work here wore those German biergarten uniforms. But I digress.   The food here looks amazing, but I opted to just go for the beer and pretzels and had bites of my friends' burgers...which was pretty darn good. Next time I'm definitely going to try the pork belly sliders.  Overall, if you've got a big group of folks and want to just chill and hang out during a warm SF afternoon/evening, then come on over to Hayes Valley and sit your butts down here and enjoy a fat brew!

4odC28scHx_y9URM0_1wyw.review_text: We went with a crew a few weeks ago.  It's good and I know it will probably get better.  So far the outdoor situation and tables are great and the location is a perfect idea.  Pretzels are yummy.  Kraut is tasty.  Food comes fast.  Mmmmmustard.  I like that they used container ship crates as their workspaces.  Park across the street for kids and kids are even allowed in!  And beer, who doesn't go to a biergarten and like that?!  Things that need tweeking are...  Waitressing - it needs to exist, so far it didn't  More glasses (or 2 dishwashers, haha) - they were hovering the tables for any glassware anyone would give up  The beer lineup was retarded!  Too too too long.  If oom pah pah places all over the world can supply beer to your table in several minutes then it must be able to happen here too.  My suspicion is that the human line acts as a free visual ad aid for Biergarten as the public goes by - like, "ooh, what is that over there?? It must be popular... such a massive lineup!!  Let's go see!"  Maybe they should think about installing more beer pull taps - there are only 4 and the person taking your money is also the person pouring your beer - just takes toooo long.  ID needs to be checked at the entrance rather than every single time you go through the beer lineup.  They can make high/low stamps or whatever other idea there might be but something better.  As of now we were sending one person up to get beers for all of us - so each time a person went up to buy beer that person had to bring an ID up for each beer that was purchased - awkward and long-handed.   I believe it can happen!  I have hope.

C469FeAyiATdaNmgXjZYWQ.review_text: Finally been to the Biergarten - it's across the street from me but it took me 10 months to try it! Good thing for half days. And a testament to how popular it is!  Beer selection is okay -- you could always go to suppenkuche for beer without a wait. The real advantage is having a pretzel, a pickle, or a brat outside on long picnic tables with groups of up to ten to a table.  They carded a friend of ours who was over 40. He didn't have his ID because we were doing a company offsite before that required running. They didn't care. Color me ignorant, but that feels like some pretty unempowered employees IMHO. Are we in sf?  Die Bier garten habt real estate but that's it in my opinion. Outside drinking and food and ample space? Go to the falafel place.

570kiZ_3AyLYNKpihpA05A.review_text: Pro: Great beer. Beautiful, refreshing location even when its windy as fuck and you're freezing your buns off (they have blankets).   Con: Food is yum but TINY for what you pay...Expected for Hayes Valley so, in regards to location, sensible. Also, you kind of feel like you're in an episode of Portlandia. HIPSTER CENTRAL. Mustaches galore.   Synopsis: Go with a group of friends. The tables are huge and make sitting together, easy. Also, you order on your own so no awkward, "should we split the bill" convo.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: Why aren't there more places like this in SF?!  Finally checked Biergarten out yesterday because Suppenkuche had an hour and a half wait.  It was pretty freaking cold at Biergarten because it was 7 pm in November, but the staff was walking around handing thick blankets to everyone (: !!  Such a great place for day drinking or for celebrating a birthday with a large group.  Definitely coming back during the day.

zSmXDPctUMmii1ult-tXHg.review_text: Atrocious service. It took 1 hour 15 standing in line to get a beer, so we each stocked up on 2 litres when we did get served. SF lacks nice places like this to sit outside in the sun and drink a beer, and they are taking advantage of this fact.   When I arrived at the bar they were out of 1L glasses, but more were coming from the dishwasher. The barman twiddled his thumbs for 3 minutes, waiting for the glasses, and not serving anyone else. It seems like they are doing their very best to be as slow as possible. And then they expect a tip!  I'm Irish, so I know effective bar service and the duty a barman has not to make people wait. Employing some general efficiency in your work is a good start. And processing more than one order at a time is effective too; does however require the brainpower to remember more than one drink order. These people show neither interest in happy customers, nor even in making more money quicker for the owners or tips for themselves. Disgraceful. I won't be back. It's run even worse than its sister restaurant Suppenküche.

J7A_ZVBZ6IMxM3BK9HciYA.review_text: Three star is for service because they not allowed you to bring outside food and you can not have to go beer and the stuff is not friendly  The beer they have is the best you can find around

OfnwNMQXhdjLSE8b1FViaA.review_text: Yummo!  Had a liter of Pils, the lardo on brown bread (sublime!), the charctuerie on a pretzel knot (perfectly salty) and a pretzel with mustard and horseradish (just the right chew) and a just-right pickle.  Sitting outside with great food and a lot of beer on a beautiful and sunny San Francisco day is about as good as it gets.  The wait was well worth it and the location perfect for people watching (most were actually watching us inside the fence....)

x9Jj7iepr2n59Rs2zCxnXg.review_text: Biergarten is a welcome outdoor space on those rare San Francisco sunny days. If you notice that the forecast is going to be nice over the weekend, plan to line up at Biergarten a bit before they are open so you can get a beer and a coveted spot at the communal tables while it is still warm.   They don't open until 3pm so you only have about 2 hours of warm sun to enjoy out there. Not sure why they can't open at noon so we can all make the most of the sun and some lunch at Biergarten.  Right now the beer and ID checking lines just combine in to one looong very slow line. Just order the largest beer you can  because after you wait in that huge line once you will not want to wait in it again just to get another beer.  I have also tried the  beautiful pink deviled eggs and the pretzels with mustard and horseradish. both are excellent beer snacks. At least they have an extra line so you can pick up snacks without getting in the beer line. They don't have very many beers on tap, maybe 3, but you are really there for the atmosphere. For those looking for a lighter drink try the Radler, a lemon + beer shandy.

kDk5Sun6adcCkcMdslBJIg.review_text: Ive come here a few times and everytime has been great! i always run into cool people to chat with there! i love the pretzels, brats and beer! the atmmosphere is always fun, very casual and who doesnt like to drink beer outside on a beautiful day! this is the perfect place to go with friends when you are in Hayes Valley!

3hZQz7XPXmH2c47s7U7kPw.review_text: Had to wait in line for about 40 minutes but it was well worth it. The banana knot, pretzel with banana, hazelnut butter and honey was delicious. Very enjoyable with a larger group of people on a sunny day.

p6VpnzidZzpOPa03TrcK0w.review_text: The good ol' beer garden. A novelty in SF (or maybe I'm just living under a rock) but plenty in all of Europe. SHIET this was good.   Here you'll find some wonderful imported German beer offerings, from your nice and light hefeweizens to the dark lagers. Speak of the dark lagers, my all-time favorite go-t here o is the Köstrizer, a nice dark lager full of chocolate notes and a smooth finish. Think Guiness but more flavorful and not as heavy.   Yes, the half-liters and liters are pricey, but you're essentially paying for this nice outdoor bar environment. Their snack options, especially the German pretzel, are outstanding. Pricey, but oh so delicious with that special brown mustard they serve. Didn't get to try the pickled deviled eggs, but friends liked it.   Last, on a really cold San Francisco day (I mean really cold not the stupid usual 65 degrees), the Biergarten staff hand out blankets for all the patrons. Definitely makes you feel like a badass struggling through a Russian winter.

xRJyMR1_QPuZuUhUuVaooQ.review_text: Great outdoor beer garden style place to drink delicious beers and eat delicious German food.  Picnic table style seating so chances are you'll be sharing a table with strangers given the limited seating.  The frankfurter on a pretzel roll was very tasty and my beer was excellent.  I felt like a warrior drinking from one of the liter steins.  The only downside, and it's a big one, is the wait time for a drink or a re-fill.  If you plan on having more than one drink, keep someone in line at all times because it took 30+ min to get our first drink and the line kept getting longer and longer.

YGTefRmhNo1ONyU3ZqVEnA.review_text: This place is awesome.  San Francisco is waaaaaay short on patios, so if you want to enjoy a cold beer, some snacks and a whole lot of sunshine, this is the place to do it.  Be warned there are always lineups though.  It seems intimidating, but is totally worth it.  You'll wait like 15minutes in line, don't stress, enjoy the day.  The interesting thing about this place is that you have to line up every single time you want a beer, you can't order at the tables.  What this means is that there is a pretty consistent turnover of the tables, so once you've ordered your beer, you can usually always find a place to sit.    They are associated with Suppen Kuchen across the street, so you are guaranteed some quality in the snack foods they serve.  :)

04JttCeiTpGmy-7XJtn2Gw.review_text: As a resident of Hayes Valley, the Biergarten is at the top of my "Go To" List. It is a perfect place to enjoy the afternoon sun with a cold beer and some great bar snacks, like the soft pretzel's, pickles and brats.  The staff is friendly and the location is centrally located right on Octavia in Hayes and is a few steps away form the shopping and other attractions in the area.  The Biergarten is a popular spot, so the line can get pretty long. My advice is order all your beers at once... and if you are contemplating a half v full pint, always go with the big boy. You will thank me when you don't have to get back out of your seat and wait 20 mins in line for a beer.  Overall, I like the experience and day drinking is a SF specialty, so this is a great spot to make it happen.

qUJmdUBUXEy7_73Ie_CWrQ.review_text: Great place to grab a beer.

j6GK2SSR2g-B2peogcws_Q.review_text: YO CHECK DIS OUT. Alright so we're walking by with a small shih-tzu in tow and we notice that a few people inside have their dogs with them. Like 3-4 dogs. One big dog, a couple small dogs. Sweet! We can take our dog in right? Nice sunny day, a few beers in the cool breeze.   STOP. Employee says "no dice, you can't bring dogs in." I politely point out that there are 3-4 canines behind him inside. "Sorry, those are service dogs." "You mean like seeing eye dogs?" "Yep." "So one of us stays outside with the dog while the rest of our large group sits down and has some beer. Meanwhile, another dog is carried in under the arms of an obviously non-disabled, non-bliind patron. She's not nixed by the very same employee who nixed us. In fact, they are carrying on laughing and having a long convo.  I go up to ask and I say, "Sorry, lemme just confirm....dogs are not allowed unless they are service dogs.....so this little bundle of fun is a service dog of some sort?" The lady giggles, in front of the employee, and says "Eh, yeah. He helps me with my stress."  SO, if you have a dog and you want to bring him in.....my advice is to tell the obviously-not-giving-a-shit employees that your dog is a service dog and he helps you forget your war memories and shit. Your welcome.

Cv7ojfqfwDbLlrNJpfWxkg.review_text: This place is so cool! I've always seen it and have wanted to stop in for a drink but now that I actually have, I will definitely be returning.   I went on a Thursday night with some co workers, not expecting to have too grand of a time. But it turned out to be so great! Just the atmosphere of things was awesome, everyone of the customers seemed like they were genuinely having a good time and would like to chat with you, kind of a Portland feel!  The venue itself was super cute with tables to share and sit with others and like at festivals. The lighting wasn't too dim at night with their string lights, was just perfect!  Although the beer selection isn't too large, it was really good! Tried multiple and they had a lot of good german beers, for a good price! The food was Great. Authentic and very tastey! Bratwurst was great!!  Now they don't get 4 stars because of two things, the employees weren't too kind, kind of grumps to be honest, and it got really cold! They should get heating lamps! But they did have blankets, which is nice... But what if the person before had lice?!   Either way, I'll definitely go back.

J3d-o-CSeERm_fBWtliXdw.review_text: For a perfect spring day & summer night....love the outdoor feel and the monster drinks they have on hand. The waiting in line and hovering over the tables staring down peeps so you can sit is a bit disturbing but once you do find a table...sit there..enjoy your wealth of drinks and good eats!

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: I love the concept of ordering up a round of beer and enjoying it in an outdoor's patio environment on a sunny, cool day.  Dine over beer - it is simple and relaxing.  They have a variety of beer selections and there are many picnic tables to lounge at with a group or two.    They provide side snacks, such as pretzels and salads, if you feel like you need something to munch on with their well-flavored beer.  Otherwise, a liter of beer is all good by itself.  Biergarten is purely a delight for recreational and leisurely purposes!

OuJTbeuKUi5km7jAqHusrw.review_text: Tip: 1L of some good german beer, hoppen hef is a good one.   This spot is really meant for a nice day. All outdoors with beers and food being served out of  old shipping containers. Nicely done.   Went there for a quick beer but the weather was not so cooperative and quite cold so felt a bit rushed to drink quickly and get out of there.   Didn't get a chance to try their food but perhaps next time.

eDjB7sq7L6i2W1l4BbN3RA.review_text: I like the idea of ordering a large beer, some fried pickles, and sitting outside in the middle of the city for some excellent conversation and people watching.  Biergarten is the perfect place to drink quality beer in large amounts and not have to deal with the "scene" of most beer bars these days.  Check it out.

39qhGXAarAMzz7Uex4D5dg.review_text: Greatest idea ever. San Francisco needed more outdoor drinking establishments.

FgGiQc9zpM_va5JZMvJtMQ.review_text: This is an outdoor rectangle of happiness. It doesn't get better than being outside, sitting at a picnic table with buddies, enjoying excellent German beers in big vessels and exposing your taste buds to an epic savory snack voyage. While it can get crowded, there is no other comparable rectangle of joy in San Francisco, and that's not the only thing that makes the Biergarten uber special.   You really cannot go wrong with the food. As a sister to Suppenkuche, the Biergarten maintains the standard of shut the front door delectable flavor. Order literally anything, but I can speak for the bratbasket, pretzels, meat knot, potato salad, and the deviled eggs. Give your inner savoryphile something to rave about and order literally anything.   Suppenkuche rocks my restaurant world, and the Biergarten is just another way to enjoy it's most excellent fruits. Prost!

E1os0IkyDUO_W9SJBu-L8w.review_text: I LOVE this place! It has been my new after-work spot since I moved here. Great atmosphere, very friendly service and great food. I think the beers are great and they swap out new ones every few days. Honestly, who doesn't like a nice cold liter of beer on a Thursday after work?

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: The idea is awesome.  Fence off an outdoor area and serve beer.  On a sunny day, it doesn't get any better than this if you you are just looking for something to pass the time by with some good friends.    The Beer:  The beer is good German imports.  It's not gonna blow your mind away or anything, but its good.  They usually have 2 or 3 on tap.  And you have two size options.  The liter or half.  $14/$7.    The Food: Didn't try, but the pretzels looked good.  The Setting: In the middle of Hayes Valley next to a park and some other food stands makes it a gem in the city.  There is plenty of sun when the sun is out and a lot of SF culture.  Not much to the fenced off area but the food bar, beer bar, and picnic tables to hang out at.  Simple.   What I don't like:  The lines.  I recommend getting a liter if you planning on hanging around for a bit.  As with most things in SF, lines here can get ridiculous.  Of course this also depends on how lucky you are.  Anything after lunch is insane on a sunny day.  It could take you almost half an hour to get a beer and seated.  And you'll have to get back in line if you want more beer!  Maybe an express line for those that already got beer and just want a refill? If that was the case I would have given this place 5 stars!!!

YKgrNyT29bfbMKMvQnhxVQ.review_text: Um, hello! I don't know why this place doesn't have a perfect score! It is awesome!  We rode our bikes down here and arriving at 5:30, were able to score an end of a table and some great beer!  Don't forget about the regular pretzel!  The spicy mustard with horseradish is to die for! I can't wait to go back!  The blankets make it!  SF can get cold in a blink of an eye but their blankets make everything alright!

NP-675YVy9URhNmdQdnWsQ.review_text: We came on a Thursday night around 6, which turned out to be perfect. We managed to nab two picnic tables for our group and there were just enough people for it to feel cozy but not quite crowded. The line varied from about 5 to 10 deep for beer & food, which was fine. So I'd recommend it for a  Thursday - I walked by on a nice Saturday afternoon and there looked to be about 10x as many people. Honestly, I wasn't wild about the beer - I guess I'm generally preferring ales to lagers now, but the food is pretty good. The brats were a bit too mild but the pretzels were great and the pickled & deviled eggs were fun to try.

AG3qumWJW32yJtizz7-saQ.review_text: Great place to grab a beer on a sunny day.  The line gets long for beer...like 20 minute wait long...and it is the only line you can purchase the beer from.  I suggest ordering the large beers!

BSad_A8gpQ0_D-wrabpMLQ.review_text: For all you "bier" lovers out there...you must check it out...but it is soooo crowded you should try to get there earlier....it you get tired of waiting in line...tell the person in front you'll be right back and go over to get some ice cream from Smitten first....that will tie you up until the line moves....a great neighborhood for showing out of towners too...

aFO_yCma7PImpdPkA8ZC-A.review_text: Like the name obviously suggests, Biergarten is a cool outdoor spot to drink some beers with friends.  Good German beer selection and they provide blankets for you if it's cold out which is obviously quite often in SF.  Some of the blankets, however, smell like a dive bar from all of the beer spilled on them, bringing a new meaning to the term "beer blanket," but at least they provide them if you failed to bring a jacket.  The only thing that needs to be worked out here is expediting the brew service.  It's ridiculously slow.  Even if you arrive when it opens you can still expect to wait 20 to 30 minutes in line to get a beer.  Want another beer?  Get back in line.

OYN8JcC1WS9WgezpeQdZRQ.review_text: On a spontaneous decision to check out Off the Grid-Proxy, we stumbled upon the gem Biergarten. After sampling the three beer selections, we chose our beers and sat down to share our tasty pork delights from Chairman Bao in addition to an order of bratwursts, sauerkraut and pretzel.   It was a chilly night and I was grateful there were blankets to keep us toasty. As I dipped the chewy pretzel into the spicy mustard, I reflected that this is an ideal date place. After all, it's a non-pretentious outdoor dining where you feast on beer, sauerkraut, and sausages. Afterwards, if you are in the mood for something sweet, Smitten Ice Cream is right across the street where you have to opportunity to see liquid nitrogen at work.

lK_32lYJ-p_fjc01G-DPLw.review_text: This is easily my favorite outdoor place to drink with friends. I came here with a group that started out as 3 and grew to be 8, taking over a whole table. Finding seating was far easier than I anticipated for a beautiful Wednesday night around 6pm. The beer line also went much quicker than you'd think for how long it was. Our group loved the red ale, the gnomeburgers and the various types of knots (I'd say the best was the guest knot). Can't go wrong with crispy prosciutto (two words that clearly belong together). I also love that they provide blankets for those who somehow forgot what the weather in SF is really like.   I'll be back soon!

v_FgbYX_Q7-KlbRcMH7wXQ.review_text: I'm torn about this place: I love it deeply and hate it even more so at the same time. I love it because it is one of the few places in SF where you can enjoy a beer outside, weather permitting. I hate it because it takes an hour standing in line to get said beer and, only if you're extremely lucky, get a seat on a bench. I will give it 4 stars for now because it really is a nice way to spend a day outside but that's not really their accomplishment; more so the accomplishment of moody SF weather and lack of other outside drinking places.

W4M-9hB5tHIx8gGAFeMJXA.review_text: I actually really like this place, but the hassle of getting either beer or food makes it just okay.   Pros: - Great location - Outside atmosphere - Great beer & Decent Food  Cons:  - Time spent standing in line - Time spent away from the rest of your party standing in line - Time spent with the rest of your party standing in line - No pets (but I don't hold this against them, every business gets to choose their preference)

9P6rlaZJgbmnl19SFQgwig.review_text: Great place to drink with your friends on a sunny afternoon. Everyone's friendly, especially drunk on German beer! If it gets cold, large blankets are provided.  My friends and I have tried pints of different flavors of beer and they're all good. My wife's favorite is the pork belly sliders, even though the bratwurst is my favorite.  The lines can get extremely long on hotter days, but it's worth the wait if you have a friend or two to save some seats. We always try to make our way to Biergarten on warm weekends!  Plus: bathrooms on the back left!

9d9kgq7womnxi_NGKsJMEA.review_text: Cool outdoor beer garden in a great location. There are not many options for outdoor drinking in the city so this is a great addition right in the heart of Hayes Valley.  There are three German beers on tap ranging from $6 to $9 for half liters and $12 to $18 for liters. There are plenty more bottles available if the beers on tap don't do it for you.  Although when they first opened they did not have many food options they seem to have added to the menu. They have lots of small foods (pretzels, deviled eggs, chive bread, etc) to keep the beer company in your stomach. German sausages are also available if you want something larger but I wouldn't recommend coming here if you are looking for a meal though.  The line consistently looks long but it goes by really fast (5-10 minutes) and you can hop in line before you finish your last beer so you never go thirsty. The major downside is that it is not a very large place and the seating is limited so it can be tough to find a place to sit on a nice day, especially if you are in a group.  Clean bathrooms, pretty cool staff, descent crowd the times I went. Also, they have blankets to give out to people when the weather gets colder.

_dKFcQEIOkJNzk74BPKBhA.review_text: Great atmosphere, great beers, great food and an awesome place to go on a warm day. Keep in mind that it opens at 3 pm and make sure to get there by about 2:45 if you want a table. The menu is pretty limited but everything we ordered was great... I loved the beet salad and the pretzel. Definitely will head back on a nice day!

g8OdCTL-_dTZCpWHanv3Yw.review_text: This place has GREAT potential, thus 4 stars... I know we went when it was their fourth day open so they've got some kinks to work out. RIDICULOUS lines for entry, beer, and food aside, my only real complaint?  THE BOUNCER...please enjoy my rant.  Saturday 10/22 in SF was absolutely gorgeous, it was in the 80's around 3:30pm when we got in line to get into the Biergarten.  The line wrapped around the block and took us 20-30min before we got to the front for entry.  When only one group was left in front of us, we noticed some random guy just walk up to the front of the line (came from the non-line side of the block,) and start searching his pockets for his wallet.  My bf notices this and actually calls this DB out, "hey man, are you with someone or are you cutting the line??" bewildered man's response, "oh um, i have friends inside..." disgruntled bf: "dude i've got friends inside too and i still waited in this line to get in."  so the guy actually acknowledged this and went to the back of the line...score one.  so now we're at the front of the line, and it happens yet again...some b*tch just walks up and shows the bouncer her ID and the bf calls out this woman too... "hey i just chewed some a**hole out for cutting in front of everyone...you need to wait in like the rest of us."  skank "oh i have friends inside," "WE ALL have friends inside dude!" and the girl must've felt entitled and was like "uh huh" & whipped her hair at this and proceeded inside.  At this point we turn to the bouncer and ask if he's gonna keep letting people in and his lame response was "we just opened a few days ago, we're still figuring stuff out..." really??  i wanted to make the funny/dramatic point that society will start falling apart at the seams if he can't obey the rules of a line.  i mean really dude, DO YOUR JOB.  you're gonna have riots (not really,) and disgruntled patrons...this isn't cool.  upon entry into the biergarten, we weren't 5ft in the door when it happened a third time and this time I was fired up and called them out...and yet again the response they felt justified cutting the line because "we have friends inside." man i guess i should've just done that upon arriving too... i had friends inside too but i still waited! grrr...  ok enough ranting already... after all that hooplah, we still had a wonderful time.  beer line was awful so i can't wait for them to figure that one out.  i still would totally come back, i love the feel of this place.  yay beer n pretzels!  (oh and they said at some point they will be getting a pretzel warmer, yahoo!)  the pretzel came with mustard and horseradish which i'd never had but was TOTALLY delicious!!  and the bacon saurkraut?  FANTASTIC.   mmm.... go here, you won't be disappointed.

3URnnmUtONJczRyWjXmJ2Q.review_text: I love the idea of this place- a casual outdoor bar where you can grab some drinks and small things to eat and just hang out- but it's always so insanely crowded! I'm always in the mood to go to Biergarten, but then I see the line wrapping around the gates and I end up ditching that plan and going somewhere else. If you do manage to secure a table at Biergarten- first of all, congratulations. That's amazing. Secondly- yes, the prices are a bit steeper than one what expect for an outdoor bar, but the beers are good, the service is quick, and the pork belly sliders are delicious! Also- don't even think of driving here because you'll have better odds of winning the lottery than you will finding a parking spot in Hayes Valley. I was torn between 3 and 4 stars, because the negative aspects of Biergarten (like the wait,crowds, lack of parking) are not really specific to the bar, but to the neighborhood itself. So count this as 3 1/2 stars.

djxnI8Ux8ZYQJhiOQkrRhA.review_text: A friend of mine tipped me off about Biergarten - it's not too far from his house in SF. As a good German girl, I had to see for myself if this was a good drinking spot or not.  The good: - Conveniently located right off the Freeway - even if you aren't a city dweller, you can find this spot pretty easy. Simply exit at Octavia from 101 and you'll see it pretty quickly. - Parking is easily accessible, even on the weekends. - It's always fun drinking beer out in the sunshine. - Very good beer selection. Not too many choices, but the ones they have on-tap are pretty good. - Fresh baked pretzels to go with your brew. Yummy!  The not-so-great: - As with many outdoor patios, Biergarten gets pretty crowded on a relatively warm, sunny day in San Francisco. You definitely need to be aggressive when it comes to finding a seat. - Their Radler was disappointing. Having spent 3 weeks in Germany as an exchange student, I'm quite familiar with different varieties of lemonade/beer combos. This one wasn't good - way too sweet. Stick to the other drinks on the menu. - Once the sun goes down, it gets pretty chilly this time of year. Bundle up and bring a blanket! You won't regret it.  Overall, a very decent drinking experience in the city. Come with a group of friends and plan on drinking some Litres. Very fun!

NthTgIpxBm6DS4N54H2h2A.review_text: Stopped here in May for a beer and a hot pretzel. Both were great. My main complaint was that they ran out of pretzels while we were there. It got quite chilly and a pretzel would have helped stave off the cold. They do have some heavy woolen blankets you can used to huddle up as it gets cold. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would give 4.5 stars if I could.

7bAnU8PIEmAV_tUeaIdCaw.review_text: Great beer, great tapas on a sunny day. What else can you ask for? I suggest you wear warm clothes, it is San Francisco after all, some people bring blankets. This place can get pretty packed so be ready to stand and wait for tables to open up. But you can always eat ice cream or drink coffee next door.

hFCUoOVs1rA4FX9Vps9fsg.review_text: Took friends visiting out of town to Biergarten for what i think is a very SF experience, arriving promptly at 3pm to find a line formed around the entire Biergarten's fence. Judging from the number of people and the side of the area i was afraid we weren't going to find a table. That worry quickly washed away when i realized we were actually standing in the food line and not purely an entry line. Once they open the doors anyone can walk right in and bypass the line to stake out a table! I highly suggesting splitting your party up - half find a table and half stay in line to order.  I truly believe i spend half my time waiting in lines in the city. Most of the time it's to eat at places like this biergarten where reservations aren't accepted. Almost 45 minutes later we finally place our order! Order all your drinks and food the first round because you will NOT want to get back in line.  The atmosphere is perfect for a laid back group who share a love of tasty beers and german food. It's trendy, in the middle of hayes valley, neighboring Smitten's ice cream and a Blue Bottle kiosk.The wind picks up like mad as the sun starts to dim. Drinking more beer doesn't always keep us warm enough! Luckily they know this at Biergarten and provide heavy duty blankets for us wimps in SF who can't handle a little cold.  Get the pickled deviled eggs, bratwurst with sauerkraut, and pretzels to go around. The horseradish only encouraged me to drink more beer!

zosAwt-mNQhcrLhYpOA1-g.review_text: There's not a lot I enjoy doing more on a lazy San Francisco afternoon than sitting back, enjoying the fresh air, and drinking. It didn't take a genius to decide that this kind of place might thrive in a place like Hayes Valley, but I applaud him nonetheless.   There's plenty of tables, they've got a great location and on a nice day, this place is pretty close to perfect. But the wait can be long (or really long) and even with a beer, can get pretty bone-chillingly cold. If you can will yourself to look past that, you're golden!

3bh9OmTJRLNtj-dqYauugA.review_text: The lines are quite long, and the prices for beer aren't great.  Overall though, its a nice change from your dark, loud bar, and a great way to spend a nice day with friends.  Gather up your favorite people and go enjoy some sunlight.  Yay vitamin D! And beer, Yay beer!

xRy7WI7s8wdhibk8VmWK6w.review_text: Biergarten is an awesome place to drink outside and relax with your friends. I want to give this place 5 stars but I had to take a star away because of the really long wait in line to order drinks. The line goes all the way outside of the area, so much that when we first got there, I thought it was a line to get in.   The beer is good. You can get one of the large beers for about $16. There's also a bunch of different food here you can eat after drinking. I suggest having one or two people waiting in line. Once that person is close to the front, everyone needs to give their ID's to that person and they would just order all the beers. When we brought the beer back, we didn't give the ID's back to people until they gave us money for their beer lol. It worked out in the end since most people had cash.   There's a bunch of seating but it's good to get here a little early to have someone save seats, it does fill up fast. But people are friendly and don't mind sharing the tables with other people. It was sunny when we came here but there was a slight wind, which made it great. My friend told me on really nice days, this place gets crazy packed. Later on in the early evening it started getting cloudy and chilly. But that's SF for you, so be prepared.   The bathrooms are in the back. The guys restroom is just one room and inside there's the toilet seat and the urinal. The faucet is back outside in middle between the men and women doors.   Overall, this is a great place to day drink, chill and enjoy the weather outside with friends. The wait to order beer/food is a bit long but not too bad if you wait with a friend.  Pros: -1L beers for $16 -Outdoor sitting -Great place to chill with friends  Cons: -Line to order beer/food can take awhile -No music

Vp6rrcLo9MrubLNAJ4rOPw.review_text: I went on a Wednesday evening, and the line was not long at all. Had some good beer and German food. I can't complain. Also, the atmosphere and lighting are great as it gets dark out

xVMj0Y_ps5dxH8F7iGo_zg.review_text: I like this place. The traditional beer garden tables are a nice touch and the beer is always fresh. The food is typical German beer garden faire.   Its a bit industrial feeling and I'm not super fond of the chain link fence around the beer garden but it's a minor visual annoyance at best. Still a good place to drink some good German beer and soak up some SF fog..  The biggest con for me Is that it's NOT family friendly. Real German beer gardens aren't bars, they're for the whole family to enjoy.

upRh352VwnipRRWsnJP8SA.review_text: Outside beer drinking? Yes please! it may cost you an extra dollar or two but their beers are excellent in my opinion, and it's right on a park. Love this spot, and the bread pudding w/side salad was delicious!!!!  check it out.

3Lo7HJNH4XRO5ICexadJew.review_text: Relaxing outdoor space in the middle of SF? Yep, it does exist. Walking by you might mistake it for an rundown park with its miscellaneous picnics tables scattered about, but work taking the detour in.   I visited on a Wednesday night when the burger special runs - a time I highly recommend. Less crowded than weekend afternoons and food is excellent. If it gets cold just ask for a blanket! They have plenty to share.

jJ_4oO6uK8gCGq6jKFJ3xA.review_text: My cousin showed me the Yelp page for Biergarten and I tinged at the thought of going here. Hipsters. Cold SF weather. (insert something crummy about SF). Was I wrong!  When I got here with my cousin and her friend I was expecting the line to stretch out into the sidewalk but it didn't, so the wait time was very reasonable. Also keep an eye out for a space opening up so you can sit down with your glorious liter of beer. When I went to order, the person working the taps was very friendly and helped me choose a beer, even offering me if I wanted to try some to make sure I would like it.   We all got a liter of Edelweiss and that was enjoyable. As for the food (I'm not sure if it was because I was hungry or not) we ordered the bratwurst with sauerkraut and that was pretty delish. Later we asked the server as he was cleaning up our trays what he would recommend. He said that the sliders (cow tongue and pork belly) were good. I was thrown off when he said cow tongue but I just bit the bullet and ate it. It was pretty delicious on my part. Never know unless you try...  I also saw the reviews for Biergarten and saw some contradicting things. The one review saying they couldn't get a knife? There were knifes and forks a plenty! When we ran out of napkins we flagged down a server and he put in more napkins in the cup where it was organized with the forks and knives. And I'm not sick from the food...  Although it was my first time there, some pro-tips to follow by the next time I go: 1. Dress in layers (SF weather can get really cold and windy in an instant). 2. If you start getting cold, they lend out blankets, but get them before they lend them all out!  3. Just get the liter. Don't skimp out on yourself. 3. It'll probably be better to come on a "off" day, as in Wednesday or Thursday probably when they open up or later in the evening. I went on a Wednesday at around 6:30PM and it looked like it was dying out around 8PM ish. 4. GO WITH FRIENDS!!!

G_tm-a-dmje4Cou0v3Eohg.review_text: I've only been here once but this place is pretty cool. It's set outdoors so there's plenty of space. There's a bunch of benches everywhere so there's plenty of seating for people as well. I got the big glass of beer and it was pretty good, unfortunately i have no idea what i ordered (haha noob -____-"). I had to just ask the worker behind the counter to give me some recommendations and i pointed to it and said "that one". the workers were nice, no one bothers you, and the environment is really chill. it's just somewhere you can sit down, relax, talk and have a good time. I didn't order any food so i can't really comment, but i saw a lot of food orders being taken..maybe i'll try it next time heh~

tlY0QMQDyfjQAEwHnzvFnw.review_text: I really liked this spot...it's perfect for Hayes Valley.  On a nice, sunny day, this is the perfect spot for enjoying beer, wine and a small selection of edibles outdoors.  The beer options are great and after sampling a few of them, I really enjoyed everything.  The food was very good too - I had a wurst with sauerkraut, both of which were fresh and fantastic.  The pretzel was fresh and perfect as well.  This place is extremely popular and people will be put off by the long line to get in.  Seating is limited so you just have to expect it.    The crowd is very cool and chic, but still laid back.    I can imagine it being an irritating place to be on a cold, overcast or windy day (most days during a summer in San Francisco?), so I'd suggest making sure the temperature is going to be sunny and perfect before going.

OLEkdkP8u2LZKBJCHFIOwQ.review_text: This place was so trendy and I was actually expecting something better. You need to wait a long line to have beer. There are few pretzel like things to eat -- not great. Nice to sit and drink outdoors but there are lots of other places you can do that. There is not much special about this place.

yrWJ4YZWvFj_NDOvTRaAqA.review_text: They need to expand. The wait is insane. Over an hour to get in and nowhere to sit, but was able to grab one of their blankets and sit on the ground with my friends. It's a great wonderful fabulous idea that should be all over the place. Every neighborhood in every major city should have this. But it should be at least twice as big. I promise everyone will be happier. Such a cool place.

NdNHNG8Kfk6Zapegb1WNYg.review_text: Food was awesome, beer amazing, service awesome, friendly opened environment. I'll be back.

NZVlyDyTMAHfkNKaELddBA.review_text: I. Love. This. Place.   The first night I moved to San Francisco, my friends and I were exhausted from lugging furniture all day and decided to check out the neighborhood.  After a hearty meal at Patxi's, we stumbled upon the cute public space and were drawn to the twinkling lights above the Biergarten.  I've been back several times ever since.  I've tried a few of their beers (the selection isn't vast, so this isn't difficult), and my favorite is their Schneider Weisse.  I've taken every person that's visited me to this beer garden, shared seeded pretzels, pickles, and the occasional pretzel-wich, and had many great afternoons here.  It's a shame this place closes so early (especially on Sundays), but it's completely understandable based on the neighborhood and outdoor location.  Make sure to dress warmly, and keep an eye out for the friendly staff that come by with cozy blankets at night!

d8z9uG3SHTgkCNj5iVcG8w.review_text: Stopped here during a bachelorette bar crawl and have to say - way better than any smelly, stuffy bar you could otherwise go to. If you're trying to shirk the skeevy types, a well-lit picnic table ensures that only the most brazen will try to strike up a conversation - perfect for the jean-clad lady that just wants to have a goddamn beer in peace.   The beer is alright, heavy on the hoppy options if that's your scene. They serve food, which is a huge plus, and I prefer the environment considerably to Zeitgeist. If it gets chilly (or never gets not chilly, I should say) there are fleece blankets to wrap yourself in. Biergarten scored fairly low on the hipster-o-meter when we were there, but we may have just gotten lucky.   Bring cash, bring friends, and enjoy some outside beers. :-)

li85I9BtJme3KAmN02CzEQ.review_text: Dam fine place for afternoon buckets of hardy German beer and devilishly tasty snacks. Speaking of snacks, don't miss their blood devil eggs and most any dessert they have on the menu.  Best: location, beer garden, people watching, next to park and food Not so Best: parking, long line, no cocktails, need lots of sunscreen

rJtmzioJOpNCqV5mCMt34Q.review_text: BEER: 4.5 Not a large selection of beer, but definitely a great one! I probably had one of the best hefeweizens I've ever tasted in the US; it was the closest thing to the hefeweizens I tried in Munich. The red ale was also a solid choice.   FOOD: 3 Can't really say much, but I had their pretzels and pickles. Pretzels were okay, kind of dry. Homemade pickles were great.  ATMOSPHERE: 5 Outside, picnic style seating only. Laid-back. Cute. It reminded me of a backyard.

Rr64EomDocCXIzZOEO-TIg.review_text: We were visiting San Francisco and it was a particularly nice Friday afternoon with plenty of sunshine so this place sounded perfect. Plenty of seating, lively crowd, great pretzels, and most importantly, very good beer. I wish there was a place like this in LA cuz this is where it's at.

8kgQupO4TS2bpCGSPhTTIg.review_text: Amazing find tucked away in Hayes Valley. A low key beer garden with good food, beers, and atmosphere for post work shenanigans.  Though this place was crowded on a Friday afternoon, I was able to squeeze myself at the end of one of their tables, liter beer in hand. (Not as exciting as the 2 liter boot I attacked at Leopold's, but definitely reminiscent of pint/liter night in college).   Their pork belly sliders were pretty memorable, though they are small. I really wanted a pretzel :( but unfortunately by the time I had reached the front of the line they were out. Next time!!

vI2Oc__Y4ehNoO0S_v1QOg.review_text: Great beer place that provides blankets but the food prices are outrageous.

qTGlSrvoH8v84d0mSEwiQQ.review_text: love the atmosphere!!!! outdoor drinking with blankets and lights.    I can't pronounce or spell the beers we got but let's just say the place is a beer lover paradise. The food was pretty good too!!!   yes the pretzel is just as good as the other reviews say it is.  so must get something with their pretzel in it!!!!!

4XIjdvV3bz-e_NYzJRJLHg.review_text: Fun place to come for happy hour on a sunny day. There are long lines for food, drinks and the bathroom but its just because its busy....   Grab a stein and a picnic table and enjoy.

oHgFEYuxCs9KDmYZ55qHOA.review_text: Great spot to catch up with friends.  Chilly weather may thin the crowds slightly but the place was still packed around 7pm.  The half liter of Schneider Edel-Weisse hits the spot - very smooth and filling.   Haven't tried the food yet but will get there.

6hFSmCvWcf6puZB_8s4oUQ.review_text: Great idea, and the beer is authentic..as is the food.   Issue is that there aren't enough points-of-sale...lines were RIDICULOUS  last night, to the point we ended up sharing our liters and heading elsewhere so we could actually buy drinks.    Definitely much better in the afternoon - after 7pm, I'd avoid unless they get more taps and registers.

opdbggrufvUGH8gP9wHL8w.review_text: Pros:  1) It's modeled after a traditional outdoor biergarten with communal tables, some shade, and a friendly vibe. 2) They have HUGE beers. 3) There are lots of traditional German snacks and entrees.  4) It's close to BART and Muni. 5) They have clean bathrooms.
