Cons: 1) This place is expensive! A 1/2 litre will set you back $9, a full litre is almost double that! 2) There are no ciders on tap, only in bottles. 3) Parking is terrible if you are driving. 4) Lines can get long.  Overall, it's a good experience, but you are going to pay dearly for it, so if you are just looking for cheap beers, there are better options around.

fkawweeCwxO7cWq8EgEkFw.review_text: This place is legit.  It is what you would expect for great german beer and bratwurst.  They have the Hofbrau classic beer served in the HB german bubble glass steins (1/2 and full liters).  The only problem is that this place is always crowded, which is good for business, but hard to find a seat.  Good atmosphere, and a great place to stop for a beer if the lines are short, and there are several nice eateries in the local area if you aren't in the mood for a wiener.

fo3aQuxapB_QJ5lcCHOVIA.review_text: It was a cold day to be walking around in San Francisco.  This little spot on Octavia is actually housed in a shipping container -- how trendy, right?  But they provided me with a tasty pasture-raised pork bratwurst, kraut, and a hot cup of mulled wine, all of which made it tolerable to huddle at one of their outdoor tables for lunch.  The menu is small -- beer, sausages, a few things for the vegetarians.  Focus on one thing, do it well. I will definitely come back to see if it's still here the next time I'm in town.

LyrAjv8V6HWkceuTB4Xtkw.review_text: The idea of having a beer garden in the middle of a beautiful neighborhood is awesome, but there's just so much waiting!  At Biergarten, you order your beer first, then look for a seat at the communal picnic tables... that is, if you can find one by the time you get your beer.  The line to get the beer is long, especially on a beautiful Sunday when the sun's out for once.  I only waited for about 40 minutes (keyword: about).  My friends have waited for as long as an hour.  Sorta ridiculous to wait an hour just to get a beer to sit outside.    They provide blankets if it does get a little chilly!  But I do get why people's willing to wait.  Having a beer outdoors is just so much more enjoyable, especially if you can enjoy it from a legit litre glass.  Only German brews are carried here.  I do wish that they serve a bigger variety but I guess they are staying true!  You can get the smaller size, but just get the litre.  It's not worth it to go back in line just to get another and c'mon, you just look much cooler!  There was a polka band (I think) playing at the time.  Pretty cool!  In the end, cool spot, but the wait is too long for me, and I do wish there was more of a variety.

Eta74v62eS9-2UWfW3oBcQ.review_text: All I wanted was a knife, so I went to the KITCHEN.  You know, where you'd expect a knife to be.  The hipster working behind the counter gave me a blank stare when I told him that there were no more knives on our tables or at the ones around ours.  "you mean there isn't a knife in the whole place?"  Don't be snarky with me in my own city, hipster.  Just give me a fucking knife.  And then there was the pain of the next 3 days, the discomfort.  I think it was the sausage, because my boyfriend had it too (see his review somewhere below.)  Gross.  Please be cleaner.  I'll stick to Suppenkuche, Waltzwerk and/or Schmidt's.  Never gotten sick or snarked at in any of those establishments.

JUfeYfJ6XtZAWxCpC1Zw0Q.review_text: What an awesome place to spend a chill afternoon sipping on some beer, or for some full on day drinking!   This little outdoor beer garden is located in Hayes Valley, right next to a little park with a playground. Almost makes you feel like you're in a suburb, and not right in the middle of the city!  We came on a sunny Sunday afternoon a couple minutes after they opened. The line was relatively short and a couple tables were free. After we sat down though, the place started to fill up FAST! Before long, there were people standing around waiting for tables, and the line was out the entrance! I suggest trying to come as close to opening as possible, cause this place gets packed.  The beers they have are unique and tasty, and are fairly priced. They offer half and full liter glasses. I didn't get the chance to sample the food, the pretzels looked amazing! Maybe next time...

LIJyH-dZO7SERCOPjvRIGA.review_text: When it's sunny in SF, I highly recommend checking this spot out! It has an ample amount of outdoor seating (picnic tables). It's a pretty social place, which makes it awkward for those weird SF techies (not me)! I recommend coming here with a group of friends but would not recommend coming here on a date.   Now... let's talk about the important stuff... the beer! I was impressed at the size of the beer that they serve. You can either get a very large beer in a glass or a HUGE glass. Honestly, unless you're chugging the huge glass, why would you get it? Beer is pretty nasty once it's warm, so go with the smaller glass, which is still very big!   This place is located in a great location. There's tons of parking, it's close to muni/bart/freeway and if it's sunny in SF, it'll be sunny here!   Service is ehh... whatever. You order up front and then you go sit down. The woman that was working there when I was here a couple of weekends ago wasn't friendly and didn't seem like she wanted to be there - maybe she was having a bad day?

vguybeVhVDGETEm68XzggQ.review_text: Depending on the type of beer you choose a 1/2 liter can be anywhere from $6-8.  Their beer selection is limited in comparison to Suppenkuche but the Schneider weisse hits the spot. Bratwurst basket is perfect for two ($18): one sausage for each of you, a pretzel to share, and for dipping - horseradish (that WILL clear up your nose) and brown mustard. (yelp.com/biz_photos/Gfea…) The place is crowded, but as long as you are willing to make friends and share tables, it's great fun especially on a sunny Saturday afternoon.

5htZmd5SUvcM7QrKp-ITIQ.review_text: Beer garden? Where's the grass? I've been to England where beer gardens are common and this is not a beer garden. I know this is a German beer garden, but is this how German's do it?  The wait for beer is not worth it.   If you want a beer garden Park Chalet is the place. You can lounge on the grass!

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: It's a decent spot to hang out when the weather permits. When it doesn't and Karl is out in full force, they give out blankets. Although I wouldn't really want to use them because let's be real here, how often do they wash them?   Decently priced beers. Pretzel wasn't that great, but pickled devil eggs were amazing.   Sometimes there's a long arse line to get in. When that's the case it's not really worth waiting.   The crowd seems fairly mixed, although there's an occasional genius who will bring their toddler in with them and give me evil side eye just because I dropped an F bomb. Seriously, who the heck brings kids into bars? Stop doing that. Hayes Valley people, I swear.

-siweRJBohCIUFg0skChJQ.review_text: Pros: Great atmosphere  Amazing beer Superb staff   Cons: Quite pricey ($8sm/$16 lg) Closes at 9pm  Overall, this is a pretty cool spot. I would definitely recommend giving it a shot of you want some good beer in a unique, laid-back setting.

R7ALX4yl8Er_WJm_vyhzig.review_text: Yes this is a very good place to have a few biers with your friends.  The bier selection is pretty good. They seem to change the bier selection from week to week.  They have a great Oktoberfest bier right now. Brats and pretzels are good as well.  OK my 2cents on this place.  They really have to figure a way to move the bier line faster.  When it is busy it can take upwards of 15 minutes to get a bier refill.  If you are like me, when my bier is empty I WANT another bier STAT!  It seemed like our group always had someone in line to get biers for us.  If they had a dedicated person just to pour biers I am sure that the line move faster, just like they do at street fairs.  Will I go back, ABSOLUTELY,  Matthew and his brother have a pretty good thing going on there.

4RlzFohEgBdFXUGoqvpZqQ.review_text: We (my husband and I) came here a couple weeks ago on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks.   Hayes Valley has been waiting for you Biergarten!  Came here after work on one of those "70 degrees and sunny" days in San Francisco. I should have been prepared for this since I've heard so many great things, but this place was PACKED. We waited on a very long line to get our beers, but luckily while waiting on line you are able to scout out possible seats. I luckily spied two open spots at a crowded table and we swooped in. The beers are your typical german beers, but something about having them outside, under market-lights,  with a hundred other people some how makes them tastier.   But beware! When the temperature drops this place gets chilllly. Which is why they have blankets. Which I am a BIG fan of.

ixYLMqLBLo4tfcuQ-ewk9g.review_text: Great place to hang out, but I wouldn't come here for either the beer or the food- both are just OK.

OaRk-RwFEzfOtc45ff0fGA.review_text: It may be hard to snag a place to sit at times, and the beer selection is somewhat limited (4-5 beers on tap), but when the weather and company are right, this place is the damn haps.  They even give out free cookies while you're waiting in line.

YsmpZbsJAWRT0jZOzhJeLw.review_text: I love this place! Chill outdoor seating, a few beers to choose from in a 1/2 or 1 liter, excellent saurkraut and sausages, and a perfect happy hour spot with friends. I only wish they had more seating as sometimes it can get so packed and you have no where to sit but on a sunny day in SF, this is perfect.

HAv257_IVJnQT0ZIL8Nn-Q.review_text: So I live a block away from this place and have had every opportunity to come here. I like the beer, the food and the people. However every time I come here I get the feeling that I would rather be indoors. Why? Because it's cold in this area. This beer garden is only open in the evenings during the week and it's placed at the bottom of the hill which practically becomes a wind tunnel. It can be absolutely miserable at times. Yes they hand out blankets, but how can you hold a stein, a bratwurst AND a little blanket and not begin to question ... why the hell am I sitting out here? I would rather just go to Suppenküche indoors where it is warm and the same super nice people are too. I know it's about being seen and people watch, but I don't need that. I can go to the park and grab a hot coffee if I want that. I usually only come for the novelty when showing friends around the neighborhood at this point. Even though it is not one of my regular spots in the neighborhood, it is at least worth a try.

ll7_ReyVWvpHHhpsettHHQ.review_text: I really like this place! Is it weird that I'd like to have my wedding reception here? Love the layout--it's really, as everyone says, an old parking lot, and you order your beer/food in like a trailer. you have a wide selection of beers and some are in a 0.5 or 1 liter so come on an empty stomach. there's a decent selection of food--definitely try the pretzel, cheese knot, anything pretzel-related. this would be great on a warm sunny day, but i would alsoo like to come at night because they have super cute light bulbs hanging across.

59c9WVezfKKciJpWSGdlBQ.review_text: Great beer selection, can get cold. Looking forward to trying their food.

b24YVfJROxU3FxiJKs2NKQ.review_text: Another one of my favorite places to drink in San Francisco.  Every single time, yes EVERY SINGLE TIME, I have a friend from out of town visiting, this is where I take them.  And they love it too.  First, it's a nice outdoor spot, when weather permits.  They have a good variety of beers and food.  I usually order a light lager and my boyfriend and I always order pretzels and the potato salad.  I know we have tried other things which are good too but we always order that.  It's a must have!  On the weekends there is usually a long line to order drinks and food, but there are always spots open at a table.  Only once I had to walk around like a hawk while my group was waiting in line.  It doesn't get too loud and rowdy so you can actually have a nice conversation without struggling to listen to each other and screaming over the noise.    The only down side is that it closes early but it's understandable, outdoor bar in a relatively quiet neighborhood.  But no problem, there are plenty of other places to venture off to when Biergarten closes!

p6qMidPaJ96LgB_9z7xZVw.review_text: On a beautiful Saturday afternoon after having spent all morning at the new Exploratorium acting like overgrown children, my group and I decided that we should reassert our adult-ness by grabbing liters of beer at the Biergarten. None of us had ever been, though we were all intrigued by the Yelp photos of mugs as big as our heads.  We got in line at about 2:45PM-2:50PM (right before they opened), and it had already just turned the corner on the block. They opened at 3PM on the dot, and people immediately either stampeded for the shady tables scattered through the courtyard or moved towards the beer line. By the time we got to the gate, most of the tables were already filled up, so we commandeered what looked like the only empty one left right by the gate itself.  Then, we waited for our beers. It took us about 30 minutes before we even got to order. Not that I ever really mind having to wait, but I should be waiting for beers that I can't find anywhere else. The beers that Biergarten had on tap were ones that you could find at most good, local liquor shops. But whatever, we were here to enjoy the Biergarten for what it was.  At $7-10 a half liter and twice that for a full liter, and with food ranging from another $4-16 (from the knots to the baskets), Boyfriend and I ran up a $42 tab for a liter and a half of beer, a frankfurter with sauerkraut and a bratwurst with curried potatoes. Everything was yummy, but not mouthwateringly rave-worthy.  Overall verdict: a very nice little spot with the potential to be very chill, but a little over-hyped. I would totally go back -- but at the prices they're charging and for what you get in return, I might just grab their beer only instead of snagging something to munch on, too.

VRmDogwQ_KG7brajIuoc4g.review_text: This place is pretty good if you are looking for a laid-back spot during the day. If you are trying to rage then I probably wouldn't recommend coming here. Biggest reason being that they only serve beer- meaning no hard alc. So if you are trying to get rowdy then I would probably recommend Tipsy Pig or Brickyard to fulfill those needs. Anyways, the line here gets pretty long so I think if you can get there before it opens and get in line then that would probably be your best bet. If you are with a group of friends and looking to sit somewhere outside then this is definitely a cool spot as long as it isn't too windy outside. Personally, I think the Marina is more my scene but if you want a more chill place then Biergarten might be your go to!

1yv6GXttiII_-od7HaUcfA.review_text: In order to avoid the ridiculously overpriced SF Oktoberfest, my friends and I headed to Biergarten to celebrate the first day of the world's greatest drinking holiday. Lines were out the door (or rather fence), but that didn't stop us.  Biergarten is a very simple concept. You get your beer, sit down at a table with your buds, and simply enjoy the blissful world of Hayes Valley around you. Aside from lights and umbrellas, there's no decorations.   Beer selection is minimal, but high quality. For Oktoberfest, they had around 5 different beers, including the famous but mediocre Hofbräu Oktoberfestbier and the delightful Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest-Märzen. $7 for 1/2L and $14 for 1L. Pretty decent prices for high quality beer.   In addition to beer, you get your choice of typical German street foods. Bratwurst, pretzels, deviled eggs, etc. It doesn't even compare with what you'd find at a festival in Germany, but it's good enough to balance out your beer. I got a Frankfurter, which is served with mustard and sauerkraut. Although it was pretty tasty, it's not worth $8. Most of the food items are heavily overpriced, so I advise you eat before coming here.   The venue gets crowded very easily, especially on a weekend or such a big holiday, so scoping out seats is a must. They could easily put more tables in here. Also, since you're outside, be ready for the temperature changes.   Overall, a great place to enjoy one of Germany's most vital contributions to American society.

vTbQZNz8FH4jcrni7Vkl1Q.review_text: Line's suck - but can be worth it.  While it can be a veritable clustetr$%&(k on hot sunny weekend days, it is so for a reason. Beer is great, the food is better, the vibe is cool even when crowded - what else can one expect from the masterminds behind Suppenkuche?   Five stars - even WITH The insane lines.

rBFW_lVT3r400-Eg2yzVrw.review_text: In summary, there's really nothing better than being with friends under the perfect sunset after a long day of work enjoying an ice cold one and a pretzel.  Sorry, minus one star for not wanting to stand in the long line again for a refill on the beer.  Well, on to the next watering hole...

GnkhVQoyUgFtnpBE_gnk3g.review_text: Classic SF (interpret this as you please).   Yes, the vibe's kinda hipster with the fences and bar-shack-thingy. But as a non-hipster, I do love the vibe here. A small but solid selection of German beers, and the food's pretty good too (avoid the pickle jar; I can't stand pickled eggs and strawberries...). Perfect for catching up with a group of friends, so long as it's not a peak time and you can find an open table.

ULK94n8lgBIG0_F1aIYhvQ.review_text: Can't beat the vibe when the weather is good, but you have to get hear early or the lines get long and the seats fill up.  Decent selection of brews that come in a giant masse.

rLEUWS_JJ7Gh6bV0uHfHkQ.review_text: This place is awesome! It was so cold though. They should give people more blankets. Three cheers for the blankets.

GK3Uqy9eYHZgVw6_0ctmsw.review_text: Biergarten has that classic outdoor patio vibe that's great for hanging out with your favorite homies over a few pints that makes you feel like a viking (the pints make my arms feel tiny and weak). As a derivative of Suppenkuche, it's an extension of the German joint in terms of space, only featuring a much more limited menu. With only a couple lagers to choose from and a small selection of bar snacks (think: pretzels, sausages, pickle jars), Biergarten serves you mostly for a cool outdoor atmosphere when you want to impress your friends from out of town who aren't ready for the grit and grime of a typical SF dive bar. If you want more to taste, I would suggest just going to Suppenkuche down the street instead for a full meal and a better selection of beers. If you're looking to just chill on a rare sunny SF day, this is the place.  Things to know: - On really nice weekends, get there when it opens (3pm) to snag a table before it gets too crowded - They don't have space-heaters, so get cozy with some blankets provided in the far corner - They have 2 stalls of clean restrooms, so drink to your heart's content!

kNIWlxpEekeDgGjLMBC9tg.review_text: Hier ist mein lieblings kneipe!  Ich habe das Bier und der Lebensmittel sehr gern. ;)  Haha Ok just kidding, I won't attempt a German review... Yes, this really is my favorite hangout after work because it's outside and the beer and food rocks!  The people that work here are super nice, the bathrooms are clean (plus it's a good idea to have storage containers for restrooms) and lastly, the atmosphere is great.  Everyone looks like they're having a great time and I love bringing people here.  Super 5 star bonus earner:  Even if it's cold outside, thank you for providing plenty of warm blankets!  Now that's taking care of your customers!

-bj4evSejxRDuvYnmcGNrg.review_text: What a fun place, especially for an outdoorsy like me! Do anticipate a line on the weekend for this fun little shack. Once you get to the front the hostess will let you try a few of the brews on tap, hopefully you'll opt for the big stein like I did :) They also serve wine and lite bites, but given the title I think beer is the way to go. They'll have something for everyone's beer taste buds from dark to light. It's a little lot but man do they know how to utilize what little amount of space they have, it's San Francisco so go figure! There's a bunch of picnic tables for you to sit at with friends with lights that they have strung over head for when it gets darker, there's something about those lights that makes sitting out more magical. Even on a beautiful day like when we came, the staff still came around with blankets, how accommodating! I wish there were more places like these in San Jose!

Y-X11AD0MckRX4rSrAlUYQ.review_text: No beer is worth the wait this place has. Te slowest beer in San Francisco. Saturday is about a 2 hour wait for a beer.

JWrONUccWS-RexScWSPWxQ.review_text: pretzels. brats. beer. Served in exactly the right environment for such. Happiness.

IC03xM7amXLcZF1QoTCGjQ.review_text: I came here with some friends on a late Saturday afternoon, and it was packed! Biergarten definitely feels like a German beer garden. All of the bartenders were very welcoming and nice, which was a delightful change from most of the bars I've been to. I ordered a Schneider Weisse, which came in an attractive, slender, and tall glass, and it tasted just right. The ambience was conducive to fun and relaxing drinking. My friends and I sat in the den behind the bartenders' counter, which had some dim lights, perfect for making you feel a bit tipsy even after one beer. I would definitely come back again with friends!

GrktSJ7Bv9t37gwDLIlAwg.review_text: It seems like we've been waiting a long time for this place. Too bad the opening of this place has been set back time and time again because it's no longer summer. Rainy season is upon us and they will be closed. I love Suppenkuche to begin with so I knew there was no way this couldn't be good.  There's a cash only line for pretzels and pickles. The larger line is for everything, including beer and sausages. Though this line can take a long time, it's not that bad if you get yourself a liter to last yourself a while until the next one. I often find myself going to the bar many times throughout the night at a bar, but here, I can settle down with a large liter stein. The pretzel was pretty good, but not the best German pretzel I've had. It was a thin style with mustard and horseradish, comes in seeded or non-seeded versions. The bratwurst with saurkraut was delicious of course, bursting with clear meaty juice.  There are two restrooms that are very clean and roomy. Sinks are smartly located outside. The drinking area is composed of thin picnic tables and thin benches positioned in a radial fashion around a tree. The tables are really close to each other, so you can literally be trapped in the center with the tree if you exit the wrong way. Otherwise, I love the coziness of good company and warm yellow lights on a nippy evening. This really, is a biergarten.  The huge, glaring drawback is that the line to get into the place at all gets long. I understand that this must be nice once you're inside to not have people crowding around you for seats. But still. It's a funny situation. I felt like I was waiting at the border to go to the promise land and that bouncer was US customs. Either that or it felt like prison, but where being in prison was a good thing. Several other people from the inside were at the chain link fence consoling their friends on the outside. I know how this feels because I was on the outside.

SjX_4tpusPeZd_5a7txkXQ.review_text: Right next to Smittens,.. after your dessert friends get their share of ice cream,.. walk on over to the outdoor Biergarten.  They do not have a big selection of beer,. but what makes this place stand out is the outdoor wooden bench seating.  A place to hang out, have good conversations, relax and decide on what to do next for the day/night.

F9yf6eFZMyt0rPgjLFrHCw.review_text: Imagine a small, cozy parking lot filled with picnic tables and people who serve you beer and food from repurposed shipping containers, and you have Biergarten.  Simple, no fuss, no frills.  Beer is limited to a handful of selections, but all of them are good, so no problems there.  Food was very tasty -- good sausages, excellent salads.  The pretzels aren't worth all the ranting and raving, but they're still good.  This place gets really popular really quick, especially on a nice day, so get here early or be prepared to wait.  I got here 30 minutes after opening and had to wait another 30 just to get my food.  Friends who joined us later had to wait even longer.

Bwj4em3C42qDqOr5pz_-ZQ.review_text: A great interpretation of a real German biergarten. Good beer, tasty sausages and fixings.   Minus one star for the chain link fence. I know this part of Hayes Valley is temporary, but, really, that was the best you could do?

JC99U5y-KAchZIjBhf_DiQ.review_text: How is it possible that this place is packed, full, and the line for beer is almost around the corner at 3:30pm on a Sunday! Also considering they open at 3pm! Waited an hour for a beer, and it's not because the staff was moving slowly.  It appeared that people who were sitting down with their drinks, kept "cutting" and asking their friends who were waiting to get them more beers.  It feels like all the yuppies and hipster wannabe's trek it to hayes valley for the biergarten. Makes the place a little pretentious, and ignoring all of it, it's a great spot.  The beers are delicious and refreshing. Their bratwurst basket is amazing and out of this world. Sauerkraut was done perfectly. Love the pretzel, so soft and buttery.

9rdz74ub05wudQdtOPQjaA.review_text: Bratwurst dog was excellent. I had some shandy type of drink which was nice. Of course if you go on a sunny day, lines will be long and there isn't always a place to sit. Still the service is good.

lFdcgrMkHCmvTjMEw4CVDQ.review_text: I'd only come here on a Wednesday or Thursday...because every other day, you're bound to wait forever in line and share communal tables with douchey peeps.   The best food items: deviled eggs, pickled veggies, pork belly sliders and the burger. Pork belly sliders are what's up.

2AW-NegGX-SOjtk6UqVXjw.review_text: Feels as if I am back in Munich at a bier garden. Great vibe and beer. We actually walked over here while waiting for our table Suppenküche. Will definitely be back soon to try some of the food, the pretzels were amazing.

ziHpifBFfjyJQOf4DvzsQw.review_text: Stupidly busy on nice days and they need to figure out a more efficient beer delivery system.  That being said, great atmosphere, great beer and the beet salad is to die for.

uBQIboVaOfJ_BXn34_JKCA.review_text: I'm sorry but a real bier garten opens at 10 AM not 3 PM.  This just won't work with my schedule.

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: If you are lucky enough to get a seat and a beer without waiting for an hour in line, then this is a great place on a sunny day.  However if you show up and see a line, then it's a tough call since it can take a while to get through...but the beers are tasty and there are expanding the menu there.

jPG9VvKCfp4RAMuaRFD91Q.review_text: A perfect place to spend the 5 sunny days we get per year in SF.  Unfortunately, when my friends and I came here in mid-July, it was overcast and cold.  The free blankets you can borrow definitely came in handy.  We arrived maybe half an hour after opening and it was already pretty crowded.  We did manage to snag seats.  As more and more people piled in, the beer line got a bit ridiculous such that a light-weight such as myself could sober up waiting to get to the front.  Okay, I exaggerate; the wait is just annoyingly long.  With the beer line that crazy, imagine the bathroom line!  Despite the wait and crowdedness, the beer is good and the food looked good.

lIEV2jrzUrzub7b5WF-daA.review_text: One of this special places you need to know in SF. The food is quite good also.

KCaOZUnCx25FJhFr_lKsEg.review_text: The beer selection is very limited, but the ones I tried were delicious.  The prices for a 1L serving are pretty spendy, though, so I suggest asking to taste first if you're not familiar with the beers to ensure you like what you're getting.  So far I've only tried a few things from the kitchen, but everything I've tried was really good.  The pickles and deviled eggs were great snacks (though I'm not really sure I'm feeling the bright pink dye (beets?) on the eggs).  Sausages were delicious too.   Service is quick though the lines are usually pretty long.  Other patrons have been really friendly about sharing the limited number of tables.  They have heavy blankets for colder days and nights. How cool is that?  My only complaints are that it does get VERY crowded.  You can end up waiting for 15+ minutes to get a drink, and even longer to snag a table.  I wish their opening hours weren't so limited, as it's tough to get a group together while they're open.  Finally, they don't allow smoking.  Not a big deal for me, as I don't smoke, but it's yet another reason I have trouble convincing friends to come here.  Sometimes we wonder why we didn't just go to Zeitgeist..

AsZ0TjeBnhHIVxhVBP3lsA.review_text: i think i'm obligated to give the biergarten at least 4 stars just because of it's sheer proximity to me (2 blocks away). come here with a friend or 5, grab a beer, grab a blanket, laugh at the guy in the pink polo shirt and neon green shades. or not. that's the beauty of it all--you're outside in the best city in the world having a beer with some friends, do whatever you want. what could be better?  this place just makes you feel a bit optimistic about everything, despite what some may view as setbacks:  - limited beer selection = who cares, there is still beer, and all of it is good! - it's cold outside = they have wool blankets! - the obnoxious hipsters/scenesters/____ group you don't identify with = come with your own friends and ignore them!  see, everything is great at the biergarten! (disclaimer: may take a beer or 2 to agree with all of the above).

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: If there were a dictionary entry for Biergarten, it might looks something like this:  bier-gar-den [beer-gahr-dn]   noun 1. a fertile and delightful spot or region ripe for consuming beer in the great outdoors on beautiful days in san francisco.  2. zeitgeist's older, more successful/affluent, less-tattooed, and better dressed sibling in hayes valley.  True story.  Unlike Zeitgeist, however... it'll take you at least 30 minutes of standing in a single-file line to get a beer on a nice day. Heed the advice of the folks pouring and order all (yes... even if you're planning on staying for multiple hours) of your beer at one time. Even if it gets a little warm, it's much better than standing at the back of the line once you reach the bottom of your glass. Trust Uncle Ruggeford on this one, kiddos.  For the non-beer drinkers, they have a house red and house white option as well. In vino veritas!

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Once they work out all the kinks, Biergarten has a chance to be my favorite al fresco watering hole in the city.   Now about those kinks...sure, the place is brand new, has been all over Thrillist, Daily Candy, Eater SF, Urban Daddy, Tabblehopper, Yelp, etc. etc. And opening weekend happened to be one of the nicest days of the year. So we did the smart thing and hopped in line at 2:40. We were inside right at 3pm and had no problem grabbing a table, though by the time the dust settled the line to get beer was almost as long as the line to get in the door.  Couple suggestions - maybe have an auxiliary bar set up to sell bottles of beer for those that don't want to wait for the selections out of the taps. Also, it would be great to be able to order food without waiting in that same beer line...it's possible to order pretzels from the food pick up window, why not just order all food there?  That being said, we really loved the place. Tables are communal and encourage chatting with your neighbors. The pretzel I had was fantastic, love that it's served with both mustard and horseradish. And the beer? Pretty damn good.

ey6Q_D0IU0WnrK_akj68bw.review_text: Ordered 4 beers, 2 were served very warm, nearly room temp.  LIne was too long to deal with complaining.  Food was decent and the only thing keeping this place as an option for me in the future.  I changed my review to 1 star because upon further investigation I figured out the problem here.  They store their beer in a metal container type thing that didn't appear to be refrigerated.  On a sunny day like the day I went, surely the temp inside this container has to be 80 degrees+.  If a keg needs to be swapped out during the day or just before opening, it would take hours for a warm keg to cool down in a serving fridge near the taps.  I'm sure I was just victim to a newish keg that had not had the chance to cool down.  How do other bars solve this issue?  They store kegs in fridges... for a place trying to be a legit beer destination, HUGE FAIL on their part.

dAYP0eKdYHgnGLQFF5iddw.review_text: The concept is perfect: an outdoor place to sit and drink beer.  The execution, however, needs work. We waited in line for 20 minutes and when we got to the front some guy just tried to cut in line. I was already hot on this unsual 80 degree day in SF so when someone tried to circumvent the natural order of the line, I was pissed. I called him out on his violation of common decency and he reluctantly went to the end of the line. My fellow patrons appreciated my assertiveness and we moved forward. However, NOT WITHOUT TWO MORE PEOPLE TRYING TO CUT IN LINE. AND THE GUY CHECKING ID's JUST LET THIS SHIT HAPPEN! When I hassled him about it he just said "look man we just opened and still trying to figure things out." So apparently "figuring things out" means "I'm going to pretend that the line is important until someone challenges the integrity of the line and then lie down."  I'm a reasonable guy so I can say with certainty that this place was pretty cool. The beer was your standard good german beer and the food was delicious. Like I said, the concept is perfect but the people can seriously ruin it. If the employees and patrons are douches, I won't want to go back. And when San Franciscans are stereotyped as being about equal rights and fairness, its pretty damned irritating to watch them step on other people to get to the front of a line for beers.

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: FOOD: I'm not totally into what is this... German food? Kinda immediately unhealthy & unsatisfying munchings. I would only go here if I wanted an outdoor spot to drink beer at.  ATMOSHERE: Outdoor area, bunch of picnic tables to munch on stuff and drink BEER. Went to a Google event here, so even better bc the tab was taken care of. Yee. Middle of Hayes Valley so there still bunch of places around to go before or after or stroll around window shopping.   8.13

V5v4UBEURVvxKXbaatfjyg.review_text: Great place to hang out on a sunny day/night in SF.   In terms of their food - pork sliders are my favorite - the pretzel is also good. the deviled egg was a bit too salty/sour. the line to order gets long - if you just want extra food, they have a separate line for limited food menus (cash only) - i usually go to the smitten ice cream after for desert :)

aKN3Fq2uaRJTwZRPlI5GcQ.review_text: Biergarten does what it says on the tin. It is a literal beer garden, outside filled with beer and picnic tables, the perfect spot to drink with friends when out in San Francisco.  Until it rains. This place is kind of terrible when it rains.  But it almost never rains in San Francisco.   Except yesterday, when it did.   Still, I would go back. The service is friendly. There's basically just a window for ordering beer and a little bit of food. The selection of beer and wine isn't enormous, they only had a few brands, but as long as you're not picky and looking for a certain style instead, they seemed to have it. The line moved fast and the beer poured faster. After that, tons of picnic tables or standing room for you to fill in and drink at.  And yes, when it rains, there's almost no shelter (a little bit of covered space but not enough for all) so then you're stuck trying to huddle under or drink your drink out in the cold and wet. Ah well.  I enjoyed this simple, fun little space. Just don't go when it's raining. Which it almost never does. Except yesterday.

WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA.review_text: Oh. It has a name. I thought it was just some outdoor randomagical place where strangers cram in with each other onto picnic tables and drain crazy-sized glasses of beer amidst loudness.  We went on Halloween day, which upped the antics that much more. Plus, there was at least one birthday going on. My group had left while I stuck around to sing happy birthday over red velvet(?) cake. There was jack-o'-lantern carving too. But no one had candles, so I turned on the flashlight app on my phone and put it in their pumpkin.  People were super easygoing, including those waiting in the slow-moving bathroom line. Back at the tables, some dude was standing around in a tank top as chilly evening began to fall. I remember asking someone to lend the dude their cape-like thing, and it happened.  I think I got some random phone numbers and business cards too. Happy Halloween. Happy Birthday. Happy Biergarten.

KyZyu1kdc0dDpLUzECtwLw.review_text: Beirgarten is located in a friendly neighborhood, the place is surrounded by a fence in outer space. There is no actual building, but I love the lively atmosphere.

1e_QfQxgeKTfegDfAfAGWg.review_text: If you are going to charge $10 for a sausage and your overhead is a shipping container on a Hayes Valley lot, you could at least get some heat lamps for your customers. Guess all that $$$ is going to rent.

BzUgv3R694FZeT7IEo0hBw.review_text: Great open spot with large community tables to share a few (liters of) brews with your crew(s).  The line to purchase said brew can take a while, and it gets a bit chilly after the sun goes down, but y'all probably know that already.  Layer up and you'll be just fine.  It's great to have another outdoor beer garden (see biergarten) in the city.   Vielen dank!

yoT5mQ0EeB40AAMi4ZIyTw.review_text: Beer & patio. What's not to love.  We didn't eat so I can't comment on the food. The beer however certainly delivered. :)

S_MYFfvGM9HpCp04AWs86Q.review_text: On warm, sunny days (the few that SF sees), you'll find Biergarten packed -- so packed that the line to get beer wraps around the block! But in the end, very few things bring as much joy as a liter of good beer with friends in the sunshine. In my book, all the beers are delightful. The razzler (a lemonade and beer mix) is a bit sweet and doesn't have enough alcohol content for me. Yes, this little girl CAN drink :)  Tip #1: If your doom is to wait in a line that wraps around the block (and I've been there before), make your time efficient by grabbing some snack foods from the snack stand (like a pretzel - they're pretty delicious) to make the wait go by faster. Also, waiting in line with friends is always a plus.  Tip #2: If you see that you have about a third of your liter beer left and you feel a tingling sensation in your bladder, be efficient with your time and drink the rest of your beer while you wait in line for the restroom. Sometimes the line for the restroom exceeds the line for beer!  Tip #3: SF weather is fickle. At 3:00, it may seem all sunshiny and warm, but when 5:30 rolls around, it'll be gray and cold, so be prepared and come with a jacket. If you forget and the beer isn't helping you keep warm, Biergarten staff goes around, handing out blankets! How awesome is that?!?!  Tip #4: Don't skimp on the beer. Order a liter (never the half) . . . you DID just probably wait 15-30 mins for it anyway. Make your suffering worth it.

xWqvvmg9Y5u9DZJUxQGFtA.review_text: Was walking around the Hayes neighborhood and after eating at Smitten Ice Cream, stumbled upon the pre-grand opening of Biergarten. This location is more like a beer stand/food stand where there are tables you can sit out outside. They are suppose to open sometime next week. Also found out it's an extension of the beer place/restaurant, Suppenküche - so if you like that place, you'll def like this place. They had German beers on tap and bottle with different sizes. Didn't try any of the food, but it looked good. A lot of people were eating their pretzels. The outside setting was very nice. Nice place to drink beer and chill in an outside setting with friends. Will come again sometime soon.

z1hbJf-8G0VoG4LhQ63ckg.review_text: Beer, burgers, & sunshine. What more could you ask. Organic, well-crafted high quality food as well. Expect a line on sunny days though.

dSCCtCzmfDpm9B0eVhri3w.review_text: Awesome place! No indoor sitting - just picnic tables and blankets (ask for them if it's cold and windy!!!) with an usually enormous line for the beer and food.   Usually when there's a long wait, it almost always deters me from liking a place as much. Something about Biergarten doesn't do that. Good large beers, good yummy snacks - try to take turns standing in lines, because there's no table service, so you have to go back into line everytime. A great place to just chill with some beers and some food and chill in the sunshine

OKBVh-PfmT_V1jwk9MgKoA.review_text: I wish this was open today.

yb2erMSDuAAl7-KRnPX_RA.review_text: The sausage and curry potatoes are delicious! Beers are sort of expensive but I like that it is a patio and there is very cool people in this joint. When the weather is  nice it is a really cool spot to hang out and meet new people. I like the fact that they give you blankets at night if it gets cold.   Only tried one of the beers, looking forward to visit again and try a different one.

AlpltTc9Y8k8A4x5239JUw.review_text: i love, love, love, love biergarten. it's everything i love - good beer, outdoor seating and german bar food. deviled eggs, sauerkraut, pretzels, sausages...everything you could ever want in an establishment, right?  i would come here so much more often if it wasn't as pricey as it is and if i didn't have to be so aggressive to just find a place to sit. that being said, i still love this place and even had a birthday here.

FjUUV0xYhPypRuELO_XNTg.review_text: Absolutely love this place! Its so random, but I guess that just makes it even better! The whole idea of sipping on huuuuuge beer mugs with your friends on picnic tables with cutesy lighting above is genius! Hahah it was freeeeezing the night we went but luckily they had blankets readily available to people for free! (: I didn't get to try much of the food but my friends said it was delicious! The beer was yummm as well! Perfect place to chill with some friends on a lazy afternoon!

MV4KKHEaCiDKiVY2xK6roA.review_text: Is pimpin' easy? hell ya! This place is awesome. Where else can you enjoy a Liter of gold alcoholic goodness in the sun? Awesome location with very helpful staff members.   The food looks amazing, but I have yet to try the fair because I'm usually eating something else while waiting for this fine establishment to open. Almost clawing at the gate for them to open it.   Maybe the benches could be a little more strategically placed that way some people are not sitting back to back (literally).   oh and ps to the person who said they would rather go to Suppenkuche... they F'ing own biergarten.
